excerpts: I've only been for breakfast as it is around the corner from my place, but have had the Veggie Scram and the Haight Scram, both of which are excellent and come with great potatoes and some toast.
The breakfast burrito is great also, abeit a little spicy
but that is probably just me.
Definitely big portions and very fast service.
And I like that they have little packets of blackberry jam,
veggie scram.author: Alissa C.
veggie scram.review:
I've only been for breakfast as it is around the corner from my place, but have had the Veggie Scram and the Haight Scram, both of which are excellent and come with great potatoes and some toast. The breakfast burrito is great also, abeit a little spicy but that is probably just me. Definitely big portions and very fast service. And I like that they have little packets of blackberry jam, not just strawberry, because blackberry is my favorite!

Coffee is okay...not sure what kind they brew here, not my favorite, but they have a large assortment of other drinks. I really appreciate the always full water pitchers they have available, its nice not to have to ask for refills all the time.

Love the outside patio area and the ample room between tables, I never feel like I am intruding in people's personal space as I am walking around the place.

excerpts: I ordered the Mediterranean scram which consisted of scrambled eggs mixed with spinach, mushrooms, onions, tomatoes and feta cheese.
My girlfriend ordered Nutella pancakes with bananas and that tastes exactly how good it sounds!
You won't get disappointed.
mediterranean scram.author: Melissa C.
mediterranean scram.review: Chill atmosphere and nice location in the heart of SF! The food tasted homemade. I ordered the Mediterranean scram which consisted of scrambled eggs mixed with spinach, mushrooms, onions, tomatoes and feta cheese. My girlfriend ordered Nutella pancakes with bananas and that tastes exactly how good it sounds! You won't get disappointed.

excerpts: I love the Haight Scram.
The egg sandwich is surprisingly good too (choose the english muffin as your bread and see).
haight scram.author: Eli P.
haight scram.review:
I will begin this review by stating that I think the issues some people have with this place could be alleviated if everyone bussed their own table after they finish eating - the bins are over by the cooking area - do the next person after you a favor and clean up after yourself!

The Grind is an excellent breakfast spot in the Haight. Some items are better than others. For example, you get a potato option with a few items, always get the home fries (otherwise you get french fries or unimpressive hash browns). The homefries are real chopped potatoes with some veggies! The omelets and scram dishes are yummy! I love the Haight Scram. The egg sandwich is surprisingly good too (choose the english muffin as your bread and see). If you like a sweet breakfast, treat yourself with the croissant french toast!

Coffee is basic and good - they also have great smoothies. Overall, a nice place. It can get super busy, with a line going out the door. I always have a moment where I freak out and think I won't get a seat by the time I order, but that's yet to happen. Sometimes I come alone and bring a book to read while I finish my coffee, great place to do this :)

I think you  may be able to fit up to a group of 6 here, if you squish some tables together - just keep in mind you order at the counter.

excerpts: The coffee was great, and we tried many items off of the breakfast menu, including the Haight Scram, the breakfast burrito, and the chicken fried steak to name a few.
We'd definitely recommend this place to a friend.
haight scram.author: Breylan D.
haight scram.review: We loved this place! My boyfriend and I stayed in an AirBNB not too far from here and wound up quickly becoming regulars. We ate here every day because of the convenience, and how good the food actually was. The coffee was great, and we tried many items off of the breakfast menu, including the Haight Scram, the breakfast burrito, and the chicken fried steak to name a few. We'd definitely recommend this place to a friend.

excerpts: I ordered the Haight Scram (avocado, bacon, green onions) and a fruit cup.
Both were exceptional!
I would definitely go back if I lived nearby!
haight scram.author: Karina H.
haight scram.review:
This was another recommendation by one of the desk clerks at our hotel (The Metro Hotel). I am SO glad we were given this recommendation!!! The food here was AMAZING!!

I ordered the Haight Scram (avocado, bacon, green onions) and a fruit cup. Both were exceptional! I would definitely go back if I lived nearby!

excerpts: The Haight scram is a favorite, also the croissant french toast, and the amazing orange juice!
haight scram.author: Jennifer H.
haight scram.review:
This is a regular stop for me (once or twice a week) for a quiet place to sit and read, while eating some tasty food stuffs. 
The Haight scram is a favorite, also the croissant french toast, and the amazing orange juice! 

Prices are good for the portion sizes, and the staff is always very nice and accommodating. 
Definitely will continue to be my "go-to" until I move out of the lower Haight.

excerpts: Coffee is just fair, while the Haight Scram was a mess of goodness.
Check it out; cool vibe.
haight scram.author: Michael S.
haight scram.review: Young lady at the counter was charming and pleasant at 7 am, so no problem there. Coffee is just fair, while the Haight Scram was a mess of goodness. Check it out; cool vibe.

excerpts: I had the Haight scram which is scrambled eggs with avocado, bacon and cheddar cheese.
Outrageous!
There coffee and multigrain bread was delicious also.
A great little find in the area.
haight scram.author: Mrs. M.
haight scram.review: When you wake up at 5am San Francisco time, which is actually 8am NY time you start to think about breakfast. My husband and I found The Grind Cafe opened at 7am with rave reviews. I can only add to the rave reviews. I had the Haight scram which is scrambled eggs with avocado, bacon and cheddar cheese. Outrageous! There coffee and multigrain bread was delicious also. A great little find in the area.

excerpts: I've only been for breakfast as it is around the corner from my place, but have had the Veggie Scram and the Haight Scram, both of which are excellent and come with great potatoes and some toast.
The breakfast burrito is great also, abeit a little spicy
but that is probably just me.
Definitely big portions and very fast service.
And I like that they have little packets of blackberry jam,
haight scram.author: Alissa C.
haight scram.review:
I've only been for breakfast as it is around the corner from my place, but have had the Veggie Scram and the Haight Scram, both of which are excellent and come with great potatoes and some toast. The breakfast burrito is great also, abeit a little spicy but that is probably just me. Definitely big portions and very fast service. And I like that they have little packets of blackberry jam, not just strawberry, because blackberry is my favorite!

Coffee is okay...not sure what kind they brew here, not my favorite, but they have a large assortment of other drinks. I really appreciate the always full water pitchers they have available, its nice not to have to ask for refills all the time.

Love the outside patio area and the ample room between tables, I never feel like I am intruding in people's personal space as I am walking around the place.

excerpts: The food is delicious with fun creative names; the Haight Scram is my favorite.
I LOVE that they have rye toast!
I always see the same wonderful smiling ladies working the cash register and coffee bar.
They are always so nice and cheerful.
It is definitely a great treat seeing attentive help with smiles as this place is PACKED on the weekends.
Although, I have stopped by on my bus ride to work during the week and they are still there, smiling and ready to help out.
haight scram.author: Misty G.
haight scram.review:
YUM! The food is delicious with fun creative names; the Haight Scram is my favorite. I LOVE that they have rye toast! I always see the same wonderful smiling ladies working the cash register and coffee bar. They are always so nice and cheerful. It is definitely a great treat seeing attentive help with smiles as this place is PACKED on the weekends. Although, I have stopped by on my bus ride to work during the week and they are still there, smiling and ready to help out. It is so nice to be greeted with that kind of service.

For me the weekends are a toss up, if it is a nice day I will stick out the wait to sit on the patio area, but on those lazy rainy weekends I enjoy calling in my order, picking it up and enjoying food from bed or the couch with a blanket and movie. Either way, it is quick happy service.

excerpts: The food in general doesn't particularly stand out, but I can always count on the Haight scram with wheat toast and fruit instead of potatoes for a good start to the day, and I'm quite fond of the chicken pesto sandwich.
haight scram.author: Brian M.
haight scram.review:
The food in general doesn't particularly stand out, but I can always count on the Haight scram with wheat toast and fruit instead of potatoes for a good start to the day, and I'm quite fond of the chicken pesto sandwich.

The staff are what earn the place a fourth star. I'm a local regular, and I eat at the place 5-8 times a week. The cute girls and pleasant guys know my coffee order and often begin preparing it before I make it to the counter. They go out of their way to be nice to me, and they've earned my loyalty.

excerpts: I could eat the Haight Scram with tofu instead of eggs everyday!
Their toast is perfect with it- big slices of sourdough.
haight scram.author: Heidi J.
haight scram.review:
I like to call this "MTV's The Grind with Eric Nies". 

I could eat the Haight Scram with tofu instead of eggs everyday! Their toast is perfect with it- big slices of sourdough.

excerpts: For me that prize is the Haight Scram.
All the scrambles hit the spot.
You can get it with just about anything and ranging from bacon, apple sausage, lox, Niemen ranch beef, or veggies (for the health conscious).
I'm sure lunch is delightful, but why ruin a good thing when breakfast is what I want.
haight scram.author: Adam S.
haight scram.review: What is there to say about The Grind Cafe...besides that it is absolutely delicious! You know that feeling you get when you wake up late Saturday morning and you want that ultimate meal? It's the time where it's to late for breakfast but your just not ready for lunch. That is what I call "The Grind Time." The fellas and I typically roll into here like a scene out of Entourage (Aw Yeah!) with our eyes on the prize. For me that prize is the Haight Scram. All the scrambles hit the spot. You can get it with just about anything and ranging from bacon, apple sausage, lox, Niemen ranch beef, or veggies (for the health conscious). I'm sure lunch is delightful, but why ruin a good thing when breakfast is what I want.

excerpts: Had breakfast here yesterday, I'm always weary about scrambled eggs but decided to get The Grind Scram.
I really liked the way they make their scramble, lots of filling
and I like the way it's all packed in this rectangle shape with cheese on top
holding it together.
I like dense tasting texture and that's what this scramble was!
Very happy.
The Hashbrown I got was ok not the best I've had.
They need to make it more crispy on the outside, but it was good.
Coffee, eh, kinda watery.
grind scram.author: Karen T.
grind scram.review: Had breakfast here yesterday, I'm always weary about scrambled eggs but decided to get The Grind Scram. I really liked the way they make their scramble, lots of filling and I like the way it's all packed in this rectangle shape with cheese on top holding it together. I like dense tasting texture and that's what this scramble was! Very happy. The Hashbrown I got was ok not the best I've had. They need to make it more crispy on the outside, but it was good. Coffee, eh, kinda watery.

excerpts: I like the Grind Scram.
grind scram.author: Christine P.
grind scram.review: I love The Grind Cafe. I live really close by and it's so nice to be able to walk over within a minute or two. The folks are always friendly and if you're a regular coffee drinker, they'll remember and offer you recommendations on what you might like to try. The Sister and I loved the granola with yogurt and fresh fruit. Ask for a little bit more yogurt when you order though. It comes with strawberries, blueberries and bananas and at the very end I like to mix in some honey (when all of the fruit except the bananas is gone). The coffee is mediocre but the scramblers are yummy. I like the Grind Scram. Get it with the hash browns and sourdough toast and then eat the latter with a little butter and a lot of blackberry jam and you're all set! Viva la breakfast!

excerpts: I ordered the ham scram with avocado, toast and hash browns.
Let me tell you, I inhaled everything.
I'd put some of the scram on my toast and it'd taste even better.
As always, staff was friendly and nice, atmosphere was chill, food was awesome.
ham scram.author: Laura F.
ham scram.review: I liked this place... another cool breakfast place within walking distance. I ordered the ham scram with avocado, toast and hash browns. Let me tell you, I inhaled everything. I'd put some of the scram on my toast and it'd taste even better. As always, staff was friendly and nice, atmosphere was chill, food was awesome.

excerpts: Their Denver omelet is quite good!
denver.author: Daniel P.
denver.review:
I come here once a week or so for breakfast and coffee when I work from home.

The espresso drinks are pretty good here, as is their hot drop coffee. However I was disappointed with the iced coffee when I ordered it; it didn't seem very fresh.

The food can be pretty hit or miss. I am a huge fan of eggs benedict, and theirs is certainly passable, albeit not spectacular. They poach eggs pretty well, but their hollandaise sauce is sometimes on the tangy side for me, and they don't use very much. Their Denver omelet is quite good!

The staff are always down to earth and friendly.

excerpts: I usually got a Denver omelette or something similar, with hash browns and a bagel, and this breakfast was spot-on for me!
denver.author: Rick B.
denver.review:
Holy omelette, Batman, I'm absolutely crazy about this place.

Seriously, one of my biggest disappointments in leaving SF is that I won't have this place around the block anymore. Their menu is enormous, and the lunch and dinner sandwiches are pretty good, but breakfast at The Grind is really where it's at. The omelettes are totally delicious, and I take my eggs very seriously. Excellent toast and I love the hash browns, too (but not so much the home fries). Great bagels, smoothies, they have beer...the list goes on and on and on. Oh, and the staff is really friendly, too.

I should temper my enthusiasm with a disclaimer that I'm very biased; their breakfast is perfect for me, for the way that I like breakfast, which is very very hearty. If you're way into baked goods, then you can do a lot better, and i didn't eat enough eggs cooked any other way but scrambled or in omelette form to have a strong opinion on different preparations. I usually got a Denver omelette or something similar, with hash browns and a bagel, and this breakfast was spot-on for me!

It would merit five stars if it had better lunch which, again, is perfectly fine but not exceptional. Other than that, I'm not huge on their coffee, and I got totally spoiled on fresh-squeezed orange juice in SF so I wish they had that, too. Overall, though, 5+++ stars for breakfast, especially on warm days with the big windows open. It can be very crowded and loud on such days, though, especially on the weekends, something to keep in mind.

excerpts: I had an Denver omelette, with english muffin and fruit cup.
The omelette was pretty full... complete with egg shell.
The fruit cup was large cereal bowl large but cost a $1.50 more to substitute for potatoes.
The ice tea was a little bitter but at least they had lemon.
I wouldn't make a special trip to there
but if you are in the neighborhood not a bad choice.
denver.author: Kevin C.
denver.review: I have only had breakfast there but it was OK. I had an Denver omelette, with english muffin and fruit cup.  The omelette was pretty full... complete with egg shell.  The fruit cup was large cereal bowl large but cost a $1.50 more to substitute for potatoes. The ice tea was a little bitter but at least they had lemon.   I wouldn't make a special trip to there but if you are in the neighborhood not a bad choice.

excerpts: My aunt had the Scott Street Omlett and they did not skimp on the filling.
My mom had a Belgium waffel with strawberries/bananas drizzled with Nutella which was presented beautifully.
scott street.author: Donna P.
scott street.review: We were looking for a place to eat near CPMC (hospital). We were pleasantly surprised with this place. My aunt had the Scott Street Omlett and they did not skimp on the filling. My mom had a Belgium waffel with strawberries/bananas drizzled with Nutella which was presented beautifully. I had the BLTA on toasted sourdough with fries which really hit the spot. The food was great and the employees we're very friendly. I checked out the food that other people had sitting around us. It all looked very appetizing;  burgers, salads, bagels, breakfast, gormet coffees, teas. I have no idea why anybody would give this place less than 3 stars even if they were having a bad day.

excerpts: I got the Scott Street omelette.
It was a good size and it tasted good.
It's counter service which I wasn't a fan of and they charge if you want any dressings.
scott street.author: Tania C.
scott street.review: This was an ok spot. I felt it was overpriced for the quality of the food, but it wasn't horrible. I got the Scott Street omelette. It was a good size and it tasted good. It's counter service which I wasn't a fan of and they charge if you want any dressings.

excerpts: He picked up Scott Street omelette (his name is Scott, har-har) and a bagel on the side.
I was fully expecting to have some of the omelette, but the bagel with sun-dried tomato cream cheese was too tasty to resist.
The omelette platter was a lot more food than we were bargaining for, and I was mainly glad that I didn't order a second one.
The cider was okay, but man, that bagel and cream cheese...
I really, really, really want another one.
scott street.author: Robbin A.
scott street.review:
Came in while house sitting with the boyfriend before heading out for a drive to Sacramento. He was on another non-caffeine run, so I decided to follow up. I got a hot apple cider, which came in a fancy glass...and a paper cup sleeve with David Tennant on it. SCORE. (Of course, he ended up getting some caffeinated beverage by "accident", I'm sure.)

He picked up Scott Street omelette (his name is Scott, har-har) and a bagel on the side. I was fully expecting to have some of the omelette, but the bagel with sun-dried tomato cream cheese was too tasty to resist. The omelette platter was a lot more food than we were bargaining for, and I was mainly glad that I didn't order a second one. The cider was okay, but man, that bagel and cream cheese...I really, really, really want another one. Soon.

And honestly, with David Tennant staring at me from my cup, it is pretty much impossible for me to associate this place with anything bad. Soon, bagel and David Tennant...I will be back.

excerpts: Beautiful day helped as I sat on the patio working, drinking great coffee, and destroying the tasty Scott Street omelet (standard avocado, bacon, and assorted veggies) that was cheerily brought out to me.
Great cafe is you're looking for something in the area.
scott street.author: Dan C.
scott street.review:
In town for a few days, and The Grind was recommended by our friends who live right around the corner. Described as having "everything you need", from wifi to a great food selection, it did not disappoint in the least. Beautiful day helped as I sat on the patio working, drinking great coffee, and destroying the tasty Scott Street omelet (standard avocado, bacon, and assorted veggies) that was cheerily brought out to me. 
Great cafe is you're looking for something in the area.

excerpts: the Scott Street Omelette----pretty darn good and huge.
scott street.author: Sherie R.
scott street.review: Nothing to be upset about here. The staff is friendly and very kind. We had breakfast here this morning on the patio...with doggies too and it was super fun! I had the Scott Street Omelette----pretty darn good and huge. I had a bite of my friend's croissant french toast and if I was walking 50 miles a week like she does I would have eaten the entire plate! The food here is solid. Great atmosphere...especially on a 420 weekend!

excerpts: The Grind is a long-standing institution of Lower Haight.
lower haight.author: Jon T.
lower haight.review:
The Grind is a long-standing institution of Lower Haight. Even today, with the influx of some new businesses further east on Haight St, the Grind is still one of the only places that is reliable for all your coffee, tea, and breakfast needs. 

As a vegan, there is unfortunately not a whole lot of options at your disposal. However, you can find a tofu scramble, some hummus and bagel type offerings, as well as soy and almond milk on the menu. I believe they also occasionally have some vegan baked good selections, although I didn't see any last time I was there.

Although the vegan options aren't stellar, it's about on par with most of the rest of the neighborhood (or even SF, for that matter.) But I personally really appreciate that they have a large selection of teas. For some reason, it's rather difficult to find hot tea offerings in the area. Most of the cafes in the neighborhood tend to be very coffee centric. The Grind carries Mighty Leaf and have all of your staple varieties (plus a little more.)

Finally, the Grind is a place you actually want to hang out at and spend a little bit of your morning and afternoon. The staff is friendly and they have a good amount of seating both indoors and out. If outdoors, you get the bonus of people/bike watching on Haight St.

excerpts: A modern cafe in the midst of an old town Lower Haight.
I had the peanut butter and banana waffles with fruit and OJ
and my boyfriend had a combo with toast eggs and potatoes.
Both of our meals were delicious and was prepared quickly.
The service was good and I'd happily return on my next visit to SF.
lower haight.author: Andrea M.
lower haight.review: A modern cafe in the midst of an old town Lower Haight. I had the peanut butter and banana waffles with fruit and OJ and my boyfriend had a combo with toast eggs and potatoes. Both of our meals were delicious and was prepared quickly. The service was good and I'd happily return on my next visit to SF.

excerpts: Oh, bring blue bottle to the lower haight :)
lower haight.author: Karley A.
lower haight.review: Wow. What a joke this place is. Stood in line for 40 minutes. Right when we got to the front, one register broke. How convenient. Now we wait longer because only one person manning the second register. At this point we decided to just get the food to go. I order a pear salad, honey mustard dressing on side. Husband orders veggie melt. More waiting. I see our take out food just sitting on the counter and wait some more. No one gave it us until I asked. Phew, get me out of here already. Go to the car. Open up the food...salad, no honey mustard dressing. Veggie melt...let's just say it looked worse than jail food. They wouldn't even serve this at the fyre festival. The cheese came out of a cheese wiz can. Biggest joke of a place and waste of money. Oh, bring blue bottle to the lower haight :)

excerpts: It's my neighborhood fave in Lower Haight.
Great / good coffee, like actual Lattes, etc.
(very hard to find around here, I've tried almost everywhere).
Mimosas and beer when you want it.
Consistently awesome omlettes, my personal fave - scrambles, and a filling breakfast burrito with avocado and salsa.
All this plus a covered patio and free wifi
- Yes please!
lower haight.author: L A.
lower haight.review: I love the grind so much. It's my neighborhood fave in Lower Haight. Great / good coffee, like actual Lattes, etc. (very hard to find around here, I've tried almost everywhere). Mimosas and beer when you want it. Consistently awesome omlettes, my personal fave - scrambles, and a filling breakfast burrito with avocado and salsa. All this plus a covered patio and free wifi - Yes please!

excerpts: Each morning we woke up in the Lower Haight with a singular thought.
How fast can we move our legs to carry us down the street to The Grind.
Banana pancakes?
Check.
Breakfast croissant?
Check Check.
French Toast?
Check.
Check.
Check.
Strong, robust coffee?
Check cubed.
So worth it.
Pay no mind to the less the four star naysayers.
Cinco Estrellas, facilemente!
lower haight.author: Spider W.
lower haight.review: Each morning we woke up in the Lower Haight with a singular thought.  How fast can we move our legs to carry us down the street to The Grind.  Banana pancakes?  Check.  Breakfast croissant? Check Check.  French Toast?  Check. Check. Check.  Strong, robust coffee?  Check cubed.  So worth it.  Pay no mind to the less the four star naysayers.  Cinco Estrellas, facilemente!

excerpts: I got a the lower haight omelet with hashbroowns which I asked if they could burn a tiny bit
and they said yes.
Food came quickly & was tasty.
lower haight.author: Augustine W.
lower haight.review:
this is a great start to a fun filled trek down to HA district and if you're really feeling full you can trek all the way to golden gate park and only stop for a bite on your way back home..

I went here on two separate occasions and had breakfast and then had a lunch item. 

   First time was lunch. I ate in their tiny dining area inside. I got a cheeseburger asked for it t medium well although when it came out it was pretty red. Ate it anyway. The bun grilled was nice and this was a big ass burger took half of it home..

 Also got a smoothie. For $4 though I would not get it again.  
It was tiny and not very exciting. ( I got pineapple  coconut).  

The next time I went I ordered breakfast w/ a friend. We sat outside in their cute little dining set up.  

  He got the southwestern omelet as well as a side of corned beef hash which I do not like but he loooooved it and said it was homemade.   I got a the lower haight omelet with hashbroowns which I asked if they could burn a tiny bit and they said yes.  Food came quickly & was tasty. The portions were large (as seen in pictures)

I also got a coconut macaroon to go and it was so big it was heavy like a baseball and half dipped in chocolate.

Another plus here is they have a restroom while many establishments on Haight do not offer one to customers.

excerpts: Definitely will continue to be my "go-to" until I move out of the lower Haight.
lower haight.author: Jennifer H.
lower haight.review:
This is a regular stop for me (once or twice a week) for a quiet place to sit and read, while eating some tasty food stuffs. 
The Haight scram is a favorite, also the croissant french toast, and the amazing orange juice! 

Prices are good for the portion sizes, and the staff is always very nice and accommodating. 
Definitely will continue to be my "go-to" until I move out of the lower Haight.

excerpts: Let's start with the premise that you want some good food close by in the Lower Haight - lunch, brunch, or an early dinner - or just a coffee, tea, or smoothie.
This is a place that does all of them well, in a neighborhood where most people want them sometimes, and sometimes many people want them at the same time.
The result is: not enough space during peak times.
Just remember that all the tables close together, inside and out, are necessary.
You'll appreciate them more if you have to wait.
lower haight.author: Mike H.
lower haight.review:
Let's start with the premise that you want some good food close by in the Lower Haight - lunch, brunch, or an early dinner - or just a coffee, tea, or smoothie. This is a place that does all of them well, in a neighborhood where most people want them sometimes, and sometimes many people want them at the same time. The result is: not enough space during peak times. Just remember that all the tables close together, inside and out, are necessary. You'll appreciate them more if you have to wait. In general though, people don't dawdle too much after they've finished and it's really busy. 

Just so you know: Order at the register, go up your drinks from the counter, and eventually bus your table...*but* you'll have food brought to the table thanks to the little numbered sign. 

Their breakfast burrito is big and darn good. Really enjoyed the omelette too. Good-sized portions for all plates, whether or not you're hung over. Good coffee and DIY water. OJ was fine. I've also had the jungle juice smoothie, which is a solid green but has a fruity-banana flavor - it's excellent. 

If you need wireless, be warned that it can be slow with several users at once. Just play nicely (be considerate of your usage) and everyone should get along fine.

excerpts: To me, it's kinda like the People's Cafe (RIP) of the Lower Haight.
lower haight.author: Stephanie C.
lower haight.review:
The Grind offers many different options for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Whatever you're in the mood for they probably have. To me, it's kinda like the People's Cafe (RIP) of the Lower Haight. 

The boyfriend and I came in for brunch and were greeted with kind service. After a few minutes looking over the huge menu, we went for breakfast dishes. He had the corned beef hash with hash browns and I had the veggie scramble with home fries. The veggie scramble was made with mushrooms, onions, and tomatoes and covered in melted cheddar cheese. I thought it was pretty average, but it was nothing special -  did the job though! The boy liked his corned beef hash but wished that he had gone with the home fries, which were really delicious! 

Overall, I would definitely come here again. There's tons of options and I like the whole casual, neighborhood kinda vibe that it has. However, with tons of other options in the area and in the city, The Grind isn't at the top of my list.

excerpts: Lower Haight's terrible cell reception.
lower haight.author: kat g.
lower haight.review:
Love a lil place with outdoor seating on the four sunny days/year here in SF. No, but really, it's a cute place, it's not claustrophobic like so many other cafes, great selection, nice servers. Food looked good, though I didn't eat. I'll go back, though, it's nice to have another great meeting place in my arsenal.

More plusses: Decent kids menu, location.
Minus: Lower Haight's terrible cell reception.

excerpts: There aren't that many brunch places in Lower Haight (Kate's Kitchen and Squat and Gobble might be the only other options), so you'll probably find yourself at The Grind at some point...
lower haight.author: Elaine C.
lower haight.review:
The Grind reminds me of Squat and Gobble, The Grove, and Crepeville. These are the Cheesecake Factories* of brunch places-- You go not because the food is particularly good, but because you're sure that everyone in your group will at least find something tolerable to eat. There aren't that many brunch places in Lower Haight (Kate's Kitchen and Squat and Gobble might be the only other options), so you'll probably find yourself at The Grind at some point...



*Key differences b/t these places and Cheesecake Factory: the 100+ option menu is written on a chalkboard above the cash register, you order at counter and seat yourself at a table, and crepes instead of cheesecake.

excerpts: Nice brunch place in Lower Haight with a huge menu.
It can be really crowded in the morning.
The service is pretty slow though
lower haight.author: Igor P.
lower haight.review: Nice brunch place in Lower Haight with a huge menu. It can be really crowded in the morning. The service is pretty slow though

excerpts: Lower Haight.
lower haight.author: Michael S.
lower haight.review:
Lower Haight. A great neighborhood, and a great café.

The staff are uniformly friendly and welcoming, the food is great - try the BLTA - and filling, and the coffee, chai, and the spiced cider are just wonderful and inexpensive!

Plentiful and fast Wi-Fi.

The only downside is it's on the wrong side of the street, so it never gets warmed by the sunlight. I guess this is a plus on sweltering days, but somewhat daunting on those frosty ones. Or don't be dumb (like I am) and stop sitting outside. But I like sitting outside, watching the parade of humanity march by...

excerpts:
The Lower Haight omelet
10.
lower haight.author: Joshua K.
lower haight.review:
Let me count the ways I love The Grind:
1. Great breakfast/lunch menu with something for everyone
2. The perfect balance of price and quality
3. Outdoor seating!
4. A glass front that provides great lighting and can be opened on warmer days
5. Great coffee, tea and fresh squeezed OJ
6. I've been here many many times and not once have they gotten my order wrong
7. Even when it's crowded they get orders out relatively quickly
8. Friendly cashiers
9. The Lower Haight omelet
10. It's two blocks from my apartment

I could go on but you get the point. I love this place, and I'll miss it dearly when I'm no longer in the neighborhood.

excerpts: The Grind Cafe has been delightful for my lazy mornings in Lower Haight.
The Barista always manages to make a great latte, and the people that work there look like they enjoy working there (why is that hard to come by these days?).
My boyfriend ordered some gnarly nutella waffle, and I ordered french toast.
lower haight.author: Shel Z.
lower haight.review:
Good food, good environment, good neighborhood.


The Grind Cafe has been delightful for my lazy mornings in Lower Haight. The Barista always manages to make a great latte, and the people that work there look like they enjoy working there (why is that hard to come by these days?). My boyfriend ordered some gnarly nutella waffle, and I ordered french toast. THE FRENCH TOAST is amazing!!! 

I went back again and tried the egg sandwich and it was perfect. The portions aren't too big, like most breakfast restaurants, and the prices are reasonable. 

I'll be back again. and again.

excerpts: I used to live in Lower Haight, and let's just say that The Grind has gotten a LOT of business from me over the past three years.
My other half insisted that the group of 6 of us walk 1+ mile several hours into Bay to Breakers so he could get his Grind fix.
lower haight.author: Kathleen H.
lower haight.review:
If 3.5 stars was an option, I'd choose that, but I'm feeling generous and rounded up to 4 stars since The Grind serves breakfast all day!

I used to live in Lower Haight, and let's just say that The Grind has gotten a LOT of business from me over the past three years.  My other half insisted that the group of 6 of us walk 1+ mile several hours into Bay to Breakers so he could get his Grind fix.  I'm not sure it's THAT good, but it did help with our impending Bay to Breakers mid-afternoon hangover that comes with starting to celebrate at 7:30 am.

Run-down:
- large portions
- large variety of both breakfast and lunch/dinner options
- prices low enough that it doesn't feel like breaking the bank to eat here often
- I like the breakfast offerings more than the lunch/dinner ones
- although it gets crowded on the weekend for brunch, I've never had problems getting a table by the time my food is ready
- every once in a while, the kitchen gets really backed up and takes a while to get food to the table
- one food-related gripe is I don't like how the egg scrambles just have the cheese melted on top rather than mixed into the scramble, but that's more my preference than something "wrong" with the dish.

My go-to dish here: french toast with mixed fresh fruit OR breakfast burrito if I'm in a savory food kind of mood

excerpts: We had the breakfast burrito, lower haight omelet and strawberry banana waffle, and they were all amazing.
lower haight.author: Regina B.
lower haight.review:
This place has overall amazing food. Is quick, fresh and the portions are huge, good enough to share. I'm so glad our local friends decided to take us here.

We had the breakfast burrito, lower haight omelet and strawberry banana waffle, and they were all amazing. I must say I was most impressed about the breakfast burrito of all, one of the best I've had.

We got pretty lucky on the table situation, since the place is pretty crowded on the weekends. So that worked out well thankfully.

excerpts: This is a solid breakfast spot in the lower Haight.
It's inexpensive and they cook your food properly.
If you order a poached egg you'll get a perfectly cooked poached egg.
Their coffee drinks are prepared well and not overly sweet.
The crowd and atmosphere are both unpretentious.
I think this place gives you the most bang for your buck.
One of my favorite breaky spots.
lower haight.author: Amybeth O.
lower haight.review: This is a solid breakfast spot in the lower Haight. It's inexpensive and they cook your food properly. If you order a poached egg you'll get a perfectly cooked poached egg. Their coffee drinks are prepared well and not overly sweet. The crowd and atmosphere are both unpretentious. I think this place gives you the most bang for your buck. One of my favorite breaky spots.

excerpts: The Grind is my home office and favored Lower Haight eatery.
Good food, good pricing and a comfortable place make it a must for me everyday.
lower haight.author: Naeem N.
lower haight.review:
The Grind is my home office and favored Lower Haight eatery.  Good food, good pricing and a comfortable place make it a must for me everyday.  The staff is uber friendly and they are always smiling (Andrea and C-Sha and Smashly are da best).  

Free and reliable wi-fi, well placed power outlets, breakfast and burgers, chili and smoothies, home made iced tea and lemonade and coffee make it even better.  Busiest times are lunchtime and weekend brunch (damn you Kaiser!)

Open until 8PM during the week.  Current new discovery has been the chili oddly enough.  Ole Reliable dish:  Grind Combo with French Toast (holla for the Challah) and home fries.

excerpts: But if you are in the lower haight check it out.
lower haight.author: Kierstan G.
lower haight.review: Walking distance from my place, sunday brunch, tasty chai, outdoor seating that is dog friendly what more could I ask for?  I wouldn't drive all the way to the grind from another neighborhood just for their brunch.  But if you are in the lower haight check it out.

excerpts: Great to place to stop in and grab a bite to eat, especially if you are perusing around Lower Haight.
lower haight.author: Nick C.
lower haight.review:
Great to place to stop in and grab a bite to eat, especially if you are perusing around Lower Haight. They serve up good portions, and have a wide variety of different things to choose from.

Breakfast + Lunch stuff mainly. They have a good amount of Scrambles to choose from, pancakes, omelets, etc...more importantly they have quality sour dough toast...not that cheap stuff. Their Burgers looked good, made with Niman Ranch Beef. 

Beverages: They have a wide variety. Everything from Gatorade to  Soda's to Smoothies to Ice Tea/Lemonade to Beers

RECOMMENDATION: Try an Arnold Palmer with their Ginger Ice Tea...stuff is really good.

The spacing is open, and they have good ventilation. There is plenty of sun and a good amount of seating.

excerpts: I like the layout and outdoor seating (although does the sun ever come out in lower haight?)
lower haight.author: Sonia S.
lower haight.review:
Why can't there be a similar place in good ol' SOMA?  Came in for breakfast early on a saturday morning when it was quiet and I could take my time reading the extensive menu.

The breakfast choices are great-- had the egg white mediterreanean scramble with hash browns and a latte and it was out of this world.  So much food that I had to take some home for later.  I like the layout and outdoor seating (although does the sun ever come out in lower haight?)  Next time I'm going for the breakfast burrito and french toast because they looked quite awesome. 

staff is friendly as well. I'm a fan.

excerpts: There is nothing particularly offensive or unusually good about this Lower Haight neighborhood breakfast spot.
Decent coffee.
Usually buzzing with people who live near by.
You won't be disappointed if it's an ordinary sort of day.
lower haight.author: Luke M.
lower haight.review: There is nothing particularly offensive or unusually good about this Lower Haight neighborhood breakfast spot.  Decent coffee. Usually buzzing with people who live near by. You won't be disappointed if it's an ordinary sort of day.

excerpts: There's not many brunch spots in Lower Haight.
The only other one I can think of is Kate's Kitchen and maybe Katz (but not really).
Luckily with the limited number of real brunch spots in Lower Haight, The Grind is pretty good.
lower haight.author: David C.
lower haight.review:
There's not many brunch spots in Lower Haight. The only other one I can think of is Kate's Kitchen and maybe Katz (but not really). Luckily with the limited number of real brunch spots in Lower Haight, The Grind is pretty good. It can get busy and open seats are hard to come by but the food is better than average, coffee is good, and there's definitely some good people watching, especially if you can get a spot outside in their front patio area. 

Some items I would recommend:
-chicken fried steak and eggs
-croissant sandwich with egg and bacon
-pancakes and eggs

...as you can tell i'm not the type to order fruit and oatmeal. I like my brunch food to be hearty and unhealthy.

excerpts: I walked an energetic pooch down to the Lower Haight to go
let him let off some steam, and for me to grab a bite to eat.
30 minutes to closing time....for dinner.
I was the only one on the patio.
One coffee drinker inside.
The friendly lady at the counter let me in the cafe with the dog to order my food, and then delivered my food to me in adequate time.
There isn't anything super fancy about it...except its one of the only places to eat outside in Lower Haight, looks like it has a decent breakfast menu, and has a friendly staff.
I look forward to updating my review with my take on brunch service....
but my dinner was delightful.
Especially now that I'm eating.
lower haight.author: Lauren F.
lower haight.review:
I will say straight away that this review may not appeal to the masses who are probably yelping The Grind as a go-to place for brunch.  I didn't eat brunch here.  No sirree bob.  I walked an energetic pooch down to the Lower Haight to go let him let off some steam, and for me to grab a bite to eat.  30 minutes to closing time....for dinner.  I was the only one on the patio.  One coffee drinker inside.  The friendly lady at the counter let me in the cafe with the dog to order my food, and then delivered my food to me in adequate time.  I guess it helped that i was the only food the kitchen was cooking...or assembling as it were, seeing as though i got a sandwich with salad. 

Its a stark cafe.  There isn't anything super fancy about it...except its one of the only places to eat outside in Lower Haight, looks like it has a decent breakfast menu, and has a friendly staff.  I look forward to updating my review with my take on brunch service....but my dinner was delightful.  Especially now that I'm eating.

excerpts: while I mourn the loss of the last cheap and uncrowded brunch spot in the Lower Haight, I bet I'll still find myself here most weekend mornings.
lower haight.author: Tom H.
lower haight.review:
Yup, they remodeled. It looks like the place might have changed hands, too, since none of the same people work there anymore. Menu is similar, with a few new additions and a bump up of about a dollar per item. It is now very much a clone of Squat and Gobble. Meh. I liked it when it had terrible art on the walls instead of a wide-screen TV leaking sports-flavored light all over the place, but while I mourn the loss of the last cheap and uncrowded brunch spot in the Lower Haight, I bet I'll still find myself here most weekend mornings. Where else am I going to go?

Update: actually, i was wrong about the place changing hands, they just have some new faces working the counter.

excerpts: I was down in Lower Haight to watch the Seahawks game at Danny Coyle's (see that review in my profile).
It occurred to me that I was about to consume a great amount of alcohol, scream my ass off at my home team, and then walk/bus back to Cow Hollow/Marina area to my bro's apt.
A man needs to power up for that kind of abuse.
I hadn't eaten breakfast, I hadn't had my morning coffee, and I had already had a beer.
Warrior needs food...
lower haight.author: Will L.
lower haight.review:
I was down in Lower Haight to watch the Seahawks game at Danny Coyle's (see that review in my profile). It occurred to me that I was about to consume a great amount of alcohol, scream my ass off at my home team, and then walk/bus back to Cow Hollow/Marina area to my bro's apt. A man needs to power up for that kind of abuse. I hadn't eaten breakfast, I hadn't had my morning coffee, and I had already had a beer. "Warrior needs food... Badly!"

Bryan B. directed me up to The Grind for a sandwich. I stood in line, then tried to joke and be friendly with the gals behind the counter, who were cute but maybe having a bad day, I dunno. They didn't crack a smile, just took my order and took my money. Whatevah.

It took a while for the order to get made. There were open tables, so it didn't seem that busy, but on the other hand I was in a hurry to get back to Danny Coyle's to see the kick off. (Which fortunately I did see, as the first 5 minutes of that Seahawks@Packers game were, as a Seahawks fan, the best part of the game. Argh. Next year.) So... I stood and watched poker on their flat screen (yeah, no playoff game. It's THAT kind of place).

the sandwich was pretty tasty. The fries were ok, but they stuck a pickle into the box which dripped all over the fries. I gotta say, pickle juice on french fries is fucking gross. It makes the fries taste like they were rotten. I wound up spitting up into my water which really sucked. I like to conserve water. At least it wasn't into my beer, as I like to conserve beer more.

So... I drop a star for the unfriendliness of the lady behind the counter, and for mixing pickle juice with french fries, and another for cost. But the sandwich was pretty good.

excerpts: we ended up in the lower haight and happened upon this place.
lower haight.author: Matt S.
lower haight.review:
My wife and I decided to take off on our scooter and find a new spot in the city that we had never been.  we ended up in the lower haight and happened upon this place.  

it's a happening little spot with lots of light, big sliding windows allowing for lots of air, and outside seating which was a plus.  we had lunch (i had the crispy chicken sandwich and fries) which was very tasty and she had the chicken cheesesteak (even better!)  it was a very enjoyable, relaxing lunch with plenty of great people watching.

excerpts: Cafe nestled in the heart of the Lower Haight.
Had their Lox sandwich and a double Cappuccino.
Neither was particularly noteworthy.
Space wasn't very nice and the featured local art was bad.
If I were in the area again, I'd stick to my old standby: Squat & Gobble.
lower haight.author: Jeremy S.
lower haight.review: Cafe nestled in the heart of the Lower Haight. Had their Lox sandwich and a double Cappuccino. Neither was particularly noteworthy. Space wasn't very nice and the featured local art was bad. If I were in the area again, I'd stick to my old standby: Squat & Gobble.

excerpts: People complaining about how it is too "clean" for the neighborhood should perhaps acquaint themselves with Craigslist apartment ads for this neighborhood and see just how "cheap" it is to live in this part of the Lower Haight.
lower haight.author: Maria D.
lower haight.review:
Okay coffee - nice to pick up when you are so hungover you want to bury yourself alive.  Like right now.

EDIT April 2007:

I hate The Grind for personal reasons. Getting coffee there was basically one of those weird "this is the first day of the rest of your life" kind of moments and I will forever associate it with kicking off the shittiest two months of my very short life.  However, they are the closest place to my apt that take credit cards, serve food and have wi-fi that is not Squat & Gobble (a place I've vowed to never give another fucking dime to), so I've returned a few times to abuse the wi-fi and have my solitary weekend brunches w/ my macbook. And what do you know? the cooked food is totally decent.  3 stars.

People complaining about how it is too "clean" for the neighborhood should perhaps acquaint themselves with Craigslist apartment ads for this neighborhood and see just how "cheap" it is to live in this part of the Lower Haight.

excerpts: I ordered the Lower Haight omelet since the ingredients caught my eyes (chicken apple sausage, spinach, sun dried tomatoes, and feta... YUMMMM) and I can't remember what my friend had
lower haight.author: Marie G.
lower haight.review:
I totally forgot about yelping here since I came here in June and it was worth the random drive my friend and i took.

My friend and I happen to spot this place after finding out the Joe's pot o' Soul was supposed to be open but they weren't. We drove around to find a good breakfast/brunch spot to dine at and my friend passes by a couple places then says "Hey, what about there?" and points to the Grind Cafe. I said sure why not. We easily found parking and walked over. 

When we walked in i looked up and noticed the huge chalkboard menu. LOTS of food and snacks and drinks to choose from, definite worth 2 stars. For the variety they had everything was very well-priced (under $10 a pop except for the steak and eggs, duh) I ordered the Lower Haight omelet since the ingredients caught my eyes (chicken apple sausage, spinach, sun dried tomatoes, and feta... YUMMMM) and I can't remember what my friend had but he did have a fresh squeezed orange juice. 

The atmosphere was real nice; busy in the kitchen but very casual in the dining area. The cashier was friendly and made sure she had got our orders right. I'd like to come back here again for sure. I only give it 4 stars since I am a fan now but would like to come here more often to experience the full force of their menu :)

excerpts: The atmosphere is even pleasant, and this is an accomplishment in the Lower Haight.
But the food is just so bland.
lower haight.author: John S.
lower haight.review:
I really really really want to love this place.  I kind of do.  OK, that's not true.  

Have you ever dated a girl who was absolutely beautiful but who annoyed you nonetheless?  No, her beauty didn't annoy you, and it was natural, not a put-on or an example of masterful makeup artistry or a figment of your own delusionally hopeful imagination, but there just wasn't much else going on.  She could be smart and maybe even intelligent, but she wasn't quick on the uptake, or at least she didn't pick up on all the little cues that she should pick up on.  Those cues that you picked up on with her.  And maybe you enjoyed each other's company, but when you weren't physically together, you wondered whether you were just wasting your time with her?  And you had your breakup speech all planned out and maybe even rehearsed; you had chosen a coffeehouse or a park that you had never been to together so that neither of your memories or daily routines would be ruined by this ultimately trivial but nonetheless life-changing event?  But then when you saw her crossing the street in her cheap pink flip-flops or leaning down to pick a dandelion from the grass--and her hair would fall just so--you couldn't go through with it.  You just had to continue to be with this girl because she was beautiful, right?  Just really naturally pretty.  Someone no one in his right mind would give up.  Not without good reason?

Well, that girlfriend is The Grind Cafe.  It's gorgeous, and the menu is really promising.  The atmosphere is even pleasant, and this is an accomplishment in the Lower Haight.  But the food is just so bland.  It's not bad, and it's presented really beautifully, but on your walk home, you always find yourself wondering whether you should start spending less time here and more time at a grungier-looking restaurant that understands your needs better.

But hell, I'm a sucker for a pretty face, so I'll keep enjoying The Grind's mound of hash browns and a sunny-side-up egg.  Wouldn't you?

excerpts: The Grind is not exactly what I expected when a friend of mine suggested we have brunch in the Lower Haight.
lower haight.author: Aiden B.
lower haight.review:
The Grind is not exactly what I expected when a friend of mine suggested we have brunch in the Lower Haight. I was stoked for the idea of a divey, nasty, greasy spoon with an assertive, short-tempered wait staff that had been working there for a decade.

So I approach the place from the west, slowly, sizing it up; looks alright, so far. I see hipsters and students and art kids smoking on the patio. This is usually a good sign, at least for my tastes and general comfort level.

Once inside, however, surprise! Exposed duct work, track lighting and the ubiquitous gigantic fucking chalk board menu. The offerings looked good, though, so I chose to forgive them and let bygones be bygones while some coked out dude started yammering at my friend.

I ordered the two eggs, scram, with hash and subbed an English muffin  for the toast. I also split a short stack with my friend. For a drink, "Orange juice, and lots of it, please." The wait staff was perky, chipper and did not at all look amused... or hungover. This was a problem.

But the food was good. Really good, actually, and the short stack reminded me of home, so damn that's gotta be worth at least one star... and the eggs were yummy and there was ample hot sauce at the table (although just Tabasco... when will people get it right? ANYTHING but Tabasco!), and pretty soon I was happy and full, and I didn't have to give up 30 minutes sitting on the curb waiting for a table (that's you, Porkstore... that's what you sound like).

So, damnit, a reluctant 3... but well earned. Even if it did feel like Hayes Valley in there.

excerpts: If you are into "chalkboard restaurants" and live in the lower haight head on down to the Squat and Gobble.
The house potatoes are at least edible and the Gobble knows a thing or two about tofu scramble.
lower haight.author: AmanDave H.
lower haight.review:
Amanda Says: 
Here's what I am wondering: How is it possible for food to taste like nothing? 

David Says: 
Well, the hash browns were edible--after I covered them in ketchup

Consensus: The Grind is The Gross. The food was cold and the tofu scramble was a sorry mess. If you are into "chalkboard restaurants" and live in the lower haight head on down to the Squat and Gobble. The house potatoes are at least edible and the Gobble knows a thing or two about tofu scramble.

excerpts: Having been here too many times to count, I have to say it's got to be the most consistent place in the Lower Haight.
Can't wait to go back again!
lower haight.author: Paul Z.
lower haight.review: I'm reading some of these reviews and they are ridiculous. I live down the street and come to the Grind at least once or twice a week. The breakfast items are great. The breakfast burrito and grind combo are my favorites. So good I have to stop myself from going there more. Here's the deal, it's a very good place to grab food, be it brunch, a burger, a salad...whatever. Since the remodel, it appears that their kitchen capacity has improved dramatically too. The complaints I'm seeing on here about "poor service" and "inefficiencies" are baffling to me. Common Sense. If there is a line out the door, all the tables look full, and there are people waiting for to go orders....It's gonna take a while to get your food on a Saturday or Sunday morning. You are talking about a very clean place with above average, fairly priced food in very popular part of SF. There are too many bad ones to count. This isn't the place you go "to brunch." It's where you go because you don't want to deal with the bs that is "brunching"  but want the same or similar quality food. Having been here too many times to count, I have to say it's got to be the most consistent place in the Lower Haight. Can't wait to go back again!

excerpts: I just moved to this neighborhood and intrigued that food costs less in the Lower Haight.
lower haight.author: Wakako U.
lower haight.review: Veggie salad is great!  Spring mix, romaine, garbanzo beans, avocado, tomatoes, sprouts and cucumber.  $7.25.  Brett's Niman ranch beef steak and egg with hash brown was $10.25.  I just moved to this neighborhood and intrigued that food costs less in the Lower Haight.

excerpts: I started coming to The Grind shortly after moving to Lower Haight, and it has become my absolute favorite - I come here several times a week.
Consistently great service, friendly staff and an awesome menu.
I can't recommend it enough!
lower haight.author: Molly E.
lower haight.review: I started coming to The Grind shortly after moving to Lower Haight, and it has become my absolute favorite - I come here several times a week. Consistently great service, friendly staff and an awesome menu. I can't recommend it enough!

excerpts: A lot of variety and its all yummy...hot sandwiches, fresh salads, awesome omelettes, and the best burger in lower haight.
Great go to spot
lower haight.author: Shazia A.
lower haight.review: Great spot for breakfast or lunch...or if you're like me and like breakfast for dinner sometimes :) A lot of variety and its all yummy...hot sandwiches, fresh salads, awesome omelettes, and the best burger in lower haight. Great go to spot

excerpts: This place is an extra block further from Fillmore than some of the other breakfast options in the lower haight, which is maybe why I had forgotten about it for awhile, but not anymore!
I went yesterday and won't forget it again.
I got the oatmeal with mixed fruit and it was great.
My boyfriend got some platter of french toast, eggs, and home fries and he was delighted with the portion.
Great spot, definitely worth checking out.
It's an order-at-the-counter type place.
They do have a nice little patio, and a huge assortment of fresh baked goodies!
can't wait to go back and try one (or more)
lower haight.author: Caitlin B.
lower haight.review: This place is an extra block further from Fillmore than some of the other breakfast options in the lower haight, which is maybe why I had forgotten about it for awhile, but not anymore! I went yesterday and won't forget it again. I got the oatmeal with mixed fruit and it was great. My boyfriend got some platter of french toast, eggs, and home fries and he was delighted with the portion. Great spot, definitely worth checking out. It's an order-at-the-counter type place. They do have a nice little patio, and a huge assortment of fresh baked goodies! can't wait to go back and try one (or more)

excerpts: Great little spot in Lower Haight.
I had the garden burger and it was good, very good.
I could tell they select good quality products.
On top of this, I thought the place was reasonably priced.
Also, must mention they have a patio.
Go on a nice sunny day and sit on the patio.
lower haight.author: Eduardo A.
lower haight.review: Great little spot in Lower Haight.  I had the garden burger and it was good, very good.  I could tell they select good quality products.  On top of this, I thought the place was reasonably priced. Also, must mention they have a patio.  Go on a nice sunny day and sit on the patio.

excerpts: The best Chai in the lower Haight, except for maybe Cafe International.
Also a nice spot to watch people doing the walk of shame on weekend mornings.
Food is just ok - I try to stick to the baked goods.
Thems the goods!
lower haight.author: Colleen B.
lower haight.review: The best Chai in the lower Haight, except for maybe Cafe International. Also a nice spot to watch people doing the walk of shame on weekend mornings. Food is just ok - I try to stick to the baked goods. Thems the goods!

excerpts: My husband and I had brunch there today and he enjoyed the lower haight omelet
and I the tofu scram.
My husband commented that his omelet was "awesome" and completely cleaned off his plate.
The tofu scram was great, the first time I've tried it actually, and I think it's a great vegan-friendly dish, which is definitely hard to find.
lower haight.author: Beenish K.
lower haight.review: I love this place.  It has such a vast menu - something to please even the most picky eaters (which I know from personal experience, so trust me).  The vanilla latte is very good here, and I've been twice already for breakfast.  The veggie bagel with hummus and sprouts is positively delicious.  My husband and I had brunch there today and he enjoyed the lower haight omelet and I the tofu scram.  My husband commented that his omelet was "awesome" and completely cleaned off his plate.  The tofu scram was great, the first time I've tried it actually, and I think it's a great vegan-friendly dish, which is definitely hard to find.  Both dishes come on a big plate, with a side of toast or muffin, and hash browns, salad, or fries.  We had the hash browns and they were great.  Service is friendly and in addition to the great menu, this place also is loaded with fine pastries, cookies, and more.  A great place for lunch or breakfast or just a quick cup of coffee!

excerpts: seems weird to close so early, esp on lower haight.
when i've been there lately, i've seen a ton of people come around 6pm only to be told they're closed.
lower haight.author: Suzanne A.
lower haight.review:
i miss the old Grind.  the grimy grind.  i do like the orange mosaic counters, but overall, i miss the old grime.  this place is too bright now, too sterile, and doesn't really fit the lower-haight vibe. i do like the free wifi tho, since now i am DSL-less and a wifi nomad (see Oakside Cafe review), but i don't like the fact that they close at 6pm.  seems weird to close so early, esp on lower haight.  when i've been there lately, i've seen a ton of people come around 6pm only to be told they're closed.  seems like they're losing out on some key biz, but whatever....

another thing i don't like about the new grind is that it seems like they put in a crappier ventilation system w/ the remodel - it flatout stinks in there, a collage of fried/burnt food stink, and i always come out smelling like the stink.  yuk.  maybe once the weather gets warmer and they can open up the windows, it'll get better...one can only hope...or they'll be calling me Pepe Le Sue...

excerpts:
i dont frequent this end of the Haight that much, the 400-500 blocks are really where 80% of Lower Haight businesses are.

at any rate, been here only a few times over the last several years.
lower haight.author: Sha A.
lower haight.review:
i dont frequent this end of the Haight that much, the 400-500 blocks are really where 80% of Lower Haight businesses are.

at any rate, been here only a few times over the last several years. the front patio is nice. you can drink your beverage, grab a bite to eat (decent sandwiches) and people watch.

the odd thing is, all the hundreds of time i have driven in front of the place, i always glance over and feel like i need to pull up grab sumfin' -but then again, im always on a mission racing up the street to go do an errand. on the way back when racing down, i only have tunnel vision, i.e., to find freekin' parking close to my place. so basically, i dont really give rats ass on stopping here............................................*sorry*

excerpts: There is no reason a coffee and small breakfast should cost over $10, especially in the lower haight.
lower haight.author: Eli Z.
lower haight.review: Wow.  After hearing great things about this place I was seriously disappointed.  I went there for breakfast to find that the prices and quality of the food left much to be desired.  First of all, a breakfast sandwich, egg, meat and cheese will run you $8.  Yes, $8.  You can get a cheap one at Lee's for $2.85 or just about any other place in the city for less than $5.  There is nothing special about the food, average at best, and about 50% overpriced.  There is no reason a coffee and small breakfast should cost over $10, especially in the lower haight.

excerpts: if you're looking for breakfast in the lower haight this is the place.
sure beats waiting in line for an hour at other spots (except the porkstore which i will gladly wait in line for).
the outdoor seating is a very nice touch on a sunny day also.
lower haight.author: Andrew D.
lower haight.review: ive never had a bad breakfast at the grind. always pleasant and comfortable. i never have to wait too long and its very well priced. they got all the usual stuff you might find at any normal breakfast spot but this place always comes through. if you're looking for breakfast in the lower haight this is the place. sure beats waiting in line for an hour at other spots (except the porkstore which i will gladly wait in line for). the outdoor seating is a very nice touch on a sunny day also.

excerpts: Had Acropolis omelette with home fries and sourdough.
acropolis.author: JC M.
acropolis.review:
Delicious, worth the price!

House blend Coffee was so good and the price was very reasonable.

Had Acropolis omelette with home fries and sourdough. Highly recommended for any vegetarian. 

Hubby had breakfast sandwich with bacon and eggs and French fries and said it was delicious.

Our friend had steak and eggs and was also delicious according to him.

Will be coming back for sure!!!

excerpts: I ordered the Acropolis omelet and it was amazing!
acropolis.author: A M.
acropolis.review:
My favorite meal is breakfast/brunch and this was an awesome place to have it! I ordered the Acropolis omelet and it was amazing! It came with a large portion of PERFECT hash browns. My son had the kids pancakes and they added strawberries upon request, he also had a side of bacon (he ate every last bite-and so did I!). The restaurant has a great atmosphere, we made conversation with the table next to us throughout the meal and throughly enjoyed the atmosphere. The prices were FANTASTIC for SF and just in general. Highly recommend!

The only drawback that I could see is that there was no table service or waiters so I had to get up a couple of times to get a couple of items (not a big deal and this is probably what keeps the prices so low). 

A+

excerpts: Other items that I'm really fond of are the Haight Street, Sicilian or the South Western omelet.
You can't miss great food at a fair price with a solid coffee house vibe in a very tradition manner.
The romance continue for some time to come!
south western.author: Billy B.
south western.review: The Grind was my first San Francisco love. The girls at the counter are delightful, friendly and sweet. The food is hearty and healthy. The place is mostly a breakfast and lunch local hang. The coffee is perfect and rich. The food is always well prepared with the tastiest ingredients . A regular for me is a bagel sandwiches. I usually have a everything bagel with chicken apple sausage, swiss, scrambled eggs and tomato. Sometime I switch the cheeses around to keep it fresh. Other items that I'm really fond of are the Haight Street, Sicilian or the South Western omelet. You can't miss great food at a fair price with a solid coffee house vibe in a very tradition manner. The romance continue for some time to come!

excerpts: I opted for the De Lox Omelet (fresh lox, tomato, green onion and cream cheese topped with capers--from the menu), $13.50 plus tax.
de lox.author: Steve M.
de lox.review:
Wow, this place has reviews all over the place, from 1 star to 5 stars. I've walked by this place many times, figured I'd give it a try.  Was 9 am on a Sunday morning, only a few folks here, could easily pick your table.  Menu on the wall, order from the cashier, food brought to your table. There's plenty of outdoor seating as well.

I opted for the De Lox Omelet (fresh lox, tomato, green onion and cream cheese topped with capers--from the menu), $13.50 plus tax.

See attached piks. Omelet was chock full of lox. Those capers it was suppose to be "topped with" were absent. Would have liked to have seen more cream cheese, but all in all, made for a decent rendition, did miss the capers. The potatoes were good, not the best I've ever had, but decent. From ordering to receiving my food, took no more than 10 minutes.   

Got much busier by the end of my meal, a line started to form, including families with children.

Based on what I ordered, and didn't try anything else, was a solid breakfast.

excerpts: The omelette and hash browns are well portioned.
Love the breakfast sandwich and the lox -- hard to find hearty breakfasts like this in the city!
hash browns.author: Stephanie S.
hash browns.review: Tasty, unpretentious, solidly good breakfast/brunch/lunch spot. The omelette and hash browns are well portioned. Love the breakfast sandwich and the lox -- hard to find hearty breakfasts like this in the city!

excerpts: Hash browns cooked to perfection!
Also have a section with a lot of baked goodies.
Yum!
May have to hit this spot again before we leave.
hash browns.author: Diana E.
hash browns.review:
LOVED this place!!! Very friendly service! 
Great menu selection! Full on coffee selection as well! Had a delicious latte and  the most amazing scrambled spinach and feta egg! Hash browns cooked to perfection! Also have a section with a lot of baked goodies. Yum! May have to hit this spot again before we leave.

excerpts: Last time I was here, I got the Sicilian omelette (pesto, sundries tomatoes, fresh tomatoes, and feta cheese) with a side of hash browns and sourdough.
hash browns.author: Andrew C.
hash browns.review:
I stop in here regularly after morning rides up Hawk Hill. There's usually only a few people in the cafe around 7:30 am on weekdays, so we bring our bicycles up on the front porch area outside instead of locking them up.

Last time I was here, I got the Sicilian omelette (pesto, sundries tomatoes, fresh tomatoes, and feta cheese) with a side of hash browns and sourdough.

The coffee is decent and served in either a mug or a pint glass (kind of novel).

excerpts: Had the Grind Scramble with hash browns and sourdough toast...really good!
hash browns.author: Ed N.
hash browns.review:
Good place for a hearty breakfast and a good cup of coffee. Had the Grind Scramble with hash browns and sourdough toast...really good! Looks like it gets crowded fast and seating can be a little tough to find when it does.

Has a good vibe, staff is cool. Also, in case it matters to you, the restroom is pretty clean!

I'll definitely be back to try something else on the menu.

excerpts: Came up on the french toast topped off with blueberries and the hash browns didn't suck either!
hash browns.author: Paolo V.
hash browns.review:
Just came back from lunch, or should I say brunch? Came up on the french toast topped off with blueberries and the hash browns didn't suck either!

Other things that were neat: tall ceilings, skylights, outdoor seating, outlets along the wall, and I hear they make coffee too. I'll have to try the brew next time I'm out this way.

excerpts: The eggs were dry (ala Mc Donalds breakfast) and the hash browns lacked any salt (might or might not be a bonus for you).
The omelette was good, though.
hash browns.author: Dario R.
hash browns.review:
My order took 40 minutes (40!) to come (20 minutes after I first asked, plus 20 for the actual food). I understand that a mistake can happen, but the fact that no one even apologized grinds my nerves.

On the food: I ordered Benedict eggs, my partner an Scott St omelette. The eggs were dry (ala Mc Donalds breakfast) and the hash browns lacked any salt (might or might not be a bonus for you). The omelette was good, though. The orange juice didn't taste fresh.

Giving it 2 stars instead of 1 just for the fact that the food actually came, and it looked like no one spitted on it, which is nice.

excerpts: It came with a large portion of PERFECT hash browns.
My son had the kids pancakes and they added strawberries upon request, he also had a side of bacon (he ate every last bite-and so did I!).
The restaurant has a great atmosphere, we made conversation with the table next to us throughout the meal and throughly enjoyed the atmosphere.
The prices were FANTASTIC for SF and just in general.
hash browns.author: A M.
hash browns.review:
My favorite meal is breakfast/brunch and this was an awesome place to have it! I ordered the Acropolis omelet and it was amazing! It came with a large portion of PERFECT hash browns. My son had the kids pancakes and they added strawberries upon request, he also had a side of bacon (he ate every last bite-and so did I!). The restaurant has a great atmosphere, we made conversation with the table next to us throughout the meal and throughly enjoyed the atmosphere. The prices were FANTASTIC for SF and just in general. Highly recommend!

The only drawback that I could see is that there was no table service or waiters so I had to get up a couple of times to get a couple of items (not a big deal and this is probably what keeps the prices so low). 

A+

excerpts: I was recommended to add hash browns inside of the burrito and it was awesome.
I told myself only to eat half.....that didn't happen.
I recommend this place and have to say it's one of my top places for breakfast.
hash browns.author: Sean B.
hash browns.review: Was able to order right away, breakfast burrito came fast and hot. Was not expecting the breakfast burrito to be as big as it was. I was recommended to add hash browns inside of the burrito and it was awesome. I told myself only to eat half.....that didn't happen. I recommend this place and have to say it's one of my top places for breakfast.

excerpts: The  breakfast burrito with the hash browns inside vs. on the side is perfection.
The sandwiches are fresh and filling: club sandwich, tuna melt, and burger,
all yummy!
Have them with the curly fries if you're into that sort of thing.
My friend favors the garlic fries.
hash browns.author: Trish B.
hash browns.review:
I really enjoy the food here, and have never had one thing I didn't like.

The  breakfast burrito with the hash browns inside vs. on the side is perfection. The sandwiches are fresh and filling: club sandwich, tuna melt, and burger, all yummy! Have them with the curly fries if you're into that sort of thing. My friend favors the garlic fries. And I am ordinarily not a salad-person, but the Oriental chicken salad or the beet salad with a soup on the side makes for a filling (but light) lunch.

I would go more often, but the service is consistently very slow. I understand the restaurant does not have waiter service, so by slow I mean the lines always seem to be long, and it takes a longer time for food to come out than most places I am used to. This is especially true during weekends and lunch time, obviously (I have never been here in the morning).

I get it; they are always super busy. And there are very few brunch options in the area. Is it worth the wait? The food is really really good, so I would say it's worth it only if you are not prone to getting hangry. The fact that it takes so long is a testament to the freshness of the food, I think.

I get takeout more often than I dine in. They usually quote my pick up time as 20-30 minutes (except for one New Years Day, where takeout order wait time was estimated at over an hour! The busyness they experience is no joke). The service is not super friendly, nor have I ever experienced them being outright rude as other reviews have said. I think they just do their extremely busy job and aren't here to make friends. With the lines they get, I don't blame them.

excerpts: They serve actual hash browns!
Its just a chill local place.
hash browns.author: Shana A.
hash browns.review: I really like this place. The price for quality is great, indoor/outdoor seating.  It can get crowded on the weekends, but only at peak hours as expected. They serve breakfast all day, so good. The quality is higher than other dinners too. The menu is what you want when you want comfort food, but it's not a greasy spoon. They serve actual hash browns! Its just a chill local place.

excerpts: Instead of a "mound of hash browns" as promised, it was two connected pieces of flat pre-made style hash browns topped with cheese, with a portion of avocado and sour cream.

To do the dish right you need to grate your own potatoes or at least buy the frozen shredded potatoes and then cook the hash browns griddle style so they come out loose and crispy, not like a flat, might-have-been-a-potatoe-but-is-now-just-a-sad-example-of-factory-produced-food dish.
hash browns.author: Peter H.
hash browns.review:
This place is clean and fast and the coffee is decent and comes in nice big cups. Atmosphere is OK, you go up to the register to give your order and then they bring it to your table. 

I ordered Hash Brown Hill from their "House Favorites" and it was a significant disappointment. Instead of a "mound of hash browns" as promised, it was two connected pieces of flat pre-made style hash browns topped with cheese, with a portion of avocado and sour cream. To do the dish right you need to grate your own potatoes or at least buy the frozen shredded potatoes and then cook the hash browns griddle style so they come out loose and crispy, not like a flat, might-have-been-a-potatoe-but-is-now-just-a-sad-example-of-factory-produced-food dish.

excerpts: When we got home fries instead of hash browns,  when up to get it corrected.
Again with the home fries.
The guy's response

"I asked you if you wanted home fries or hash browns, you said home fries"  
Food is okay, nothing special for San Francisco.
I think Crepevine on Church has much better food, Squat and Gobble about the same.
Service at either place is heads above this.
hash browns.author: Dennis N.
hash browns.review:
Service is horrible,  staff is rude.  Waited forever for food, no apology, no nothing. When they finally did bring it, the order came out in very strange sequence-- first out three breakfast sausages, then the French toast, then the eggs.  When we got home fries instead of hash browns,  when up to get it corrected. Again with the home fries.  The guy's response "I asked you if you wanted home fries or hash browns, you said home fries"  
Food is okay, nothing special for San Francisco.  I think Crepevine on Church has much better food, Squat and Gobble about the same. Service at either place is heads above this.  I can't remember when I've seen such bad service and I eat out a lot. 

No brewed decafe, if that's your thing.     Add insult to injury when I asked for a refill after all this they still had the nerve to charge 50 cents

. 
Gets a star cause they do have a nice outdoor area.
