excerpts: Rectangle omelette, rectangle serving of hash browns, english muffin.
No sprig of parsley or anything to visually enhance the plate.
Hash browns were standard greasy fare.
hash browns.author: Matt S.
hash browns.review:
The Grind Cafe looked inviting. People eating in the patio area, and a decent waiting line for food. We thought the popularity of this place was an attestant to the quality of food, but we were wrong. 

After a long wait and an order, we got our coffees and found an empty table. We waited... and waited... and waited, until we finally got our food. By then, our normal ceramic cups of coffee were almost gone. Free refills? Nope. $.50 cent refills. What breakfast spots charges $.50 cent refills on coffee? Apparently this one. 

The food presentation is as bland as it gets. Rectangle omelette, rectangle serving of hash browns, english muffin. No sprig of parsley or anything to visually enhance the plate. Pancakes, fried eggs, home fries, and again, no thought to presentation.

Ok, now to the food, because hey, it's brunch, and we are too tired to really care much about the wait and presentation. Omelette was ok, nothing spectacular. Had avocado and bacon, and a hint of cheese. Overpowered by avocado, but if you love avocado, then you'll like this omelette. English muffin was barely toasted. More like warmed up. Hash browns were standard greasy fare. 

Eggs were ordered over-medium, but came out soft. Fine. Ham was actually good, so no complaints there. Home fries were hard and bland. Pancakes were the worst pancakes I've ever had at a restaurant. Do NOT order the pancakes. They are like rubber frisbees, but probably taste worse than an actual frisbee. Bland, rubbery, generic bulk instant pancake crap. 

I contemplated paying $.50 cents for a coffee refill, but couldn't bring myself to give them any more of my money.

excerpts: They have many breakfast options (only have been for breakfast): from yummy hash browns, bacon, waffles , French toast and breakfast sandwiches to the healthier choices of fruit bowls to oatmeal.
hash browns.author: Melanie D.
hash browns.review:
Sunday morning destination spot!

Although finding parking in this area on the weekends requires patience, and the long line of hungover people outside waiting to get inside on a sunday morning never fails to be there, it's menu is worth the struggle.

They have many breakfast options (only have been for breakfast): from yummy hash browns, bacon, waffles , French toast and breakfast sandwiches to the healthier choices of fruit bowls to oatmeal. Literally their are so many choices ! 

The portions are actual decent size portions compared to other breakfast places in the area that have you craving another meal an hour later. 

Service : always friendly.

excerpts: (otherwise you get french fries or unimpressive hash browns).
The homefries are real chopped potatoes with some veggies!
The omelets and scram dishes are yummy!
hash browns.author: Eli P.
hash browns.review:
I will begin this review by stating that I think the issues some people have with this place could be alleviated if everyone bussed their own table after they finish eating - the bins are over by the cooking area - do the next person after you a favor and clean up after yourself!

The Grind is an excellent breakfast spot in the Haight. Some items are better than others. For example, you get a potato option with a few items, always get the home fries (otherwise you get french fries or unimpressive hash browns). The homefries are real chopped potatoes with some veggies! The omelets and scram dishes are yummy! I love the Haight Scram. The egg sandwich is surprisingly good too (choose the english muffin as your bread and see). If you like a sweet breakfast, treat yourself with the croissant french toast!

Coffee is basic and good - they also have great smoothies. Overall, a nice place. It can get super busy, with a line going out the door. I always have a moment where I freak out and think I won't get a seat by the time I order, but that's yet to happen. Sometimes I come alone and bring a book to read while I finish my coffee, great place to do this :)

I think you  may be able to fit up to a group of 6 here, if you squish some tables together - just keep in mind you order at the counter.

excerpts: Hash browns and sourdough toast were good but they did not provide enough butter.
hash browns.author: Caitlin H.
hash browns.review: The tofu scramble here is pretty much the worst I've ever had but a lot of that was just the poor description. For one, tofu scrambles usually consist of crumbled tofu while this dish at The Grind is strips of fried tofu. Also, the description claimed peanut sauce - instead the sauce was watery and soy-like with absolutely no peanut flavor. I basically love peanut sauce and only ordered this dish for that reason. Massively disappointing. Hash browns and sourdough toast were good but they did not provide enough butter.

excerpts: and I love the hash browns, too (but not so much the home fries).
Great bagels, smoothies, they have beer...
the list goes on and on and on.
I usually got a Denver omelette or something similar, with hash browns and a bagel, and this breakfast was spot-on for me!
hash browns.author: Rick B.
hash browns.review:
Holy omelette, Batman, I'm absolutely crazy about this place.

Seriously, one of my biggest disappointments in leaving SF is that I won't have this place around the block anymore. Their menu is enormous, and the lunch and dinner sandwiches are pretty good, but breakfast at The Grind is really where it's at. The omelettes are totally delicious, and I take my eggs very seriously. Excellent toast and I love the hash browns, too (but not so much the home fries). Great bagels, smoothies, they have beer...the list goes on and on and on. Oh, and the staff is really friendly, too.

I should temper my enthusiasm with a disclaimer that I'm very biased; their breakfast is perfect for me, for the way that I like breakfast, which is very very hearty. If you're way into baked goods, then you can do a lot better, and i didn't eat enough eggs cooked any other way but scrambled or in omelette form to have a strong opinion on different preparations. I usually got a Denver omelette or something similar, with hash browns and a bagel, and this breakfast was spot-on for me!

It would merit five stars if it had better lunch which, again, is perfectly fine but not exceptional. Other than that, I'm not huge on their coffee, and I got totally spoiled on fresh-squeezed orange juice in SF so I wish they had that, too. Overall, though, 5+++ stars for breakfast, especially on warm days with the big windows open. It can be very crowded and loud on such days, though, especially on the weekends, something to keep in mind.

excerpts: ask them to put the hash browns inside the burrito and pick your choice of meat...
I chose the chicken apple sausage.
hash browns.author: Philip H.
hash browns.review:
Was craving a breakfast burrito and this place came up on yelp and it was only a few blocks away...it was awesome! ask them to put the hash browns inside the burrito and pick your choice of meat...I chose the chicken apple sausage. Yum! 

I've actually split the burrito with someone and it was plenty for breakfast! 

Us Americans eat too much some times! 

Shame on me, I can't believe I just said that.

excerpts: The service is just ok -- for some reason every time I order their home fries (or whatever those little potatos are called), I end up getting hash browns.
Never fails and always lets me down.
hash browns.author: Lee L.
hash browns.review: I stop in at The Grind from time to time to usually grab a coffee and a quick bite to eat before heading somewhere. The service is just ok -- for some reason every time I order their home fries (or whatever those little potatos are called), I end up getting hash browns. Never fails and always lets me down.

excerpts: My sunny side up eggs were just right and the hash browns crispy.
Would come back.
hash browns.author: Ted B.
hash browns.review: Wanted eggs for breakfast and the hotel pointed us here. Ice counter service and clean bright eating area. My sunny side up eggs were just right and the hash browns crispy. Would come back.

excerpts: We both ordered the Sicilian omelet, which was served with wheat toast and hash browns.
hash browns.author: Ashley G.
hash browns.review:
Took my mom for a quick breakfast bite and thought the food was P-R-I-M-E.
We both ordered the Sicilian omelet, which was served with wheat toast and hash browns. 

I was happy because they serve mimosas!

Staff was friendly, patient, and made a great recommendation!

excerpts: He had the corned beef hash with hash browns
and I had the veggie scramble with home fries.
The veggie scramble was made with mushrooms, onions, and tomatoes and covered in melted cheddar cheese.
I thought it was pretty average, but it was nothing special -  did the job though!
hash browns.author: Stephanie C.
hash browns.review:
The Grind offers many different options for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Whatever you're in the mood for they probably have. To me, it's kinda like the People's Cafe (RIP) of the Lower Haight. 

The boyfriend and I came in for brunch and were greeted with kind service. After a few minutes looking over the huge menu, we went for breakfast dishes. He had the corned beef hash with hash browns and I had the veggie scramble with home fries. The veggie scramble was made with mushrooms, onions, and tomatoes and covered in melted cheddar cheese. I thought it was pretty average, but it was nothing special -  did the job though! The boy liked his corned beef hash but wished that he had gone with the home fries, which were really delicious! 

Overall, I would definitely come here again. There's tons of options and I like the whole casual, neighborhood kinda vibe that it has. However, with tons of other options in the area and in the city, The Grind isn't at the top of my list.

excerpts: Hash browns are delicious, pancakes
so so.
I've loved all the bagel options!
They have a coffee punch card, and a great place to sit outside and people watch or gab on the phone.
hash browns.author: Kira M.
hash browns.review: Neighborhood casual- just like squat and gobble or crepe vine. Good food, fast service. Hash browns are delicious, pancakes so so. I've loved all the bagel options! They have a coffee punch card, and a great place to sit outside and people watch or gab on the phone.

excerpts: The breakfast burrito -- with veggie sausage and hash browns and avocado, sans egg -- is the best one in the city.
hash browns.author: Elinor M.
hash browns.review: The Grind is our weekend ritual. The breakfast burrito -- with veggie sausage and hash browns and avocado, sans egg -- is the best one in the city. Their sandwiches are delicious, great French Toast and the Hash Brown Hill is to die for. And they are always so sweet to us at the counter. This place is solid.

excerpts: The hash browns and homestyle potatoes leave a bit to be desired though.
There wasn't even bell peppers in the homestyle potatoes!
hash browns.author: David A.
hash browns.review:
Had an amazing Feta/spinach/sun-dried tomato omelette here. The hash browns and homestyle potatoes leave a bit to be desired though. There wasn't even bell peppers in the homestyle potatoes! With how good the omelette was, however, I can forgive this flaw. 

The menu had several options. I had trouble figuring out exactly what I wanted because a lot of it sounded good.

The place itself is right on Haight. There a patio area right next to the street or you can eat inside. Eating outside is a nice relaxing way to start the morning. We walked from our hotel our last day in San Francisco.

The service was a little odd, but I think that was mostly one worker who didn't want to be there.

excerpts: I ended up getting the classic two eggs, toast and hash browns deal.
My friend got French Toast which looked super tasty.
There was a lot on her plate too.
Portions are generous so plan accordingly.
Service is fast and seating can be tricky depending on how busy they get.
I would definitely stop in here again.
hash browns.author: Amy J.
hash browns.review: The prices are really decent here and the selection of brunch items is overwhelming. I ended up getting the classic two eggs, toast and hash browns deal. My friend got French Toast which looked super tasty. There was a lot on her plate too. Portions are generous so plan accordingly. Service is fast and seating can be tricky depending on how busy they get. I would definitely stop in here again.

excerpts: I had the tofu scramble ($8.75) which came with hash browns and toast.
I also got a glass of orange juice ($2.95).
All of the food was great and I will definitely hit this place up for breakfast again sometime soon!
hash browns.author: Anthony H.
hash browns.review: I had breakfast here with a friend a few days ago and it was definitely the perfect place to go after a wild sunday funday. There is indoor and outdoor seating with large windows. You order your food at the counter and then they will bring the food to your table. I had the tofu scramble ($8.75) which came with hash browns and toast. I also got a glass of orange juice ($2.95). All of the food was great and I will definitely hit this place up for breakfast again sometime soon!

excerpts: I enjoyed this scramble with my perfectly toasted buttered wheat bread and hash browns.
The portions are huge.
The food is delicious.
Can't wait to come back!
hash browns.author: Caroline N.
hash browns.review: The Grind is definitely a place to go to when you want a leisurely breakfast or lunch. Today was my second time coming to the Grind. The last time I went, my baby and I just had tea and pumpkin bread(which is good). This time I had the lox scramble. If you love lox, you must come here. You know how on some breakfast scrambles, the goodies are mixed quickly so the tomatoes(or whatever goodies you order) are mostly in one side? Well this scramble had omelet, lox, cream cheese, tomatoes, green onions and capers in every bite. It was cut up and mixed thoroughly. Each forkful was paradise. I enjoyed this scramble with my perfectly toasted buttered wheat bread and hash browns. The portions are huge. The food is delicious. Can't wait to come back!

excerpts: Love the scramblers and hash browns.
hash browns.author: Louis D.
hash browns.review: Great coffee and great food.  There's a reason why the lines can sometimes be a little long on the weekends.  Love the scramblers and hash browns.

excerpts: The hash browns are also quite yummy.
hash browns.author: Edgar S.
hash browns.review:
First of all, lemme preface this with my "I don't drink coffee" disclaimer and tell you right now, I have NO idea if the coffee here is worth your time because... well... I don't drink coffee. 

Now, moving on to what's important... FOOD.

I ate breakfast here twice in the two days I was in town. Day one, I got the breakfast sandwich (egg, sausage & cheese on a croissant) which you can pretty much customize to have whatever you want. That's pretty hard to mess up since it's got exactly what you want on it but it was quite tasty. The hash browns are also quite yummy.

Second day, I had the Grind Combo (I believe that's what it's called), and although it wasn't a fancy order at all, everything was quite tasty. The french toast was quite good, which is impressive because I think most places overdo it with the egg then cover them in powdered sugar like we're at Cafe du Monde or something. This place did them quite nicely. The country potatoes were also good. 

I also must say this about the staff; they are really nice. They may be granola-crunching hippies (let's face it, they're everywhere around here) but they were super sweet and very quick with the drinks and the food.

excerpts:
I chose to get their homestyle fries instead of the hash browns. 
The homestyle fries were decent.
I also went with their lattes. 
Coffee is made fairly quick, before your food is brought out to you. 
Food is made fairly quickly and brought out to you by friendly staff.
Overall the staff is friendly and are quick to serve you.
The atmosphere is somewhat quiet to average noise levels.
The place also has large windows which brings in great ambient light.
It's a great place to sit down and eat so you can enjoy your morning.
There is free wi-fi but limited on the weekends.
This place is very convenient if you're staying at the Metro Hotel. 
Just a short walk away.
hash browns.author: John S.
hash browns.review:
First time experience.

This is my favorite breakfast spot to eat at when I'm staying at the Metro Hotel.
My girlfriend and I visited this place a few times during our stay in San Francisco.
I fell in love with their croissant french toast. Adding fresh strawberries to it made it really delicious. I chose to get their homestyle fries instead of the hash browns. The homestyle fries were decent.
I also went with their lattes. Coffee is made fairly quick, before your food is brought out to you. Food is made fairly quickly and brought out to you by friendly staff.
Overall the staff is friendly and are quick to serve you.
The atmosphere is somewhat quiet to average noise levels.
The place also has large windows which brings in great ambient light.
It's a great place to sit down and eat so you can enjoy your morning.
There is free wi-fi but limited on the weekends.
This place is very convenient if you're staying at the Metro Hotel. Just a short walk away.
Prices are fair for what you receive.

The Grind Cafe is our favorite new place for breakfast.
But will also continue to come back to try their lunch menu.

excerpts: The hash browns on the side were lovely as well.
Ok
but really, this scramble was amazing.
I wanna go again.
Now.
Oh
but question: are the coffee refills free?
I was afraid to ask.
hash browns.author: Emilia S.
hash browns.review:
Two fork-fuls in, and I announced to the bf that I was in love with my breakfast. Not even joking.
I ordered the fresh lox scramble and have never, ever had something so amazing. I asked for no onions or anchovies and the request was honored, so my dish was eggs with salmon, tomatoes, avocado, and cream cheese. Yes, cream cheese sounds weird but it was sooo freakin goooood!!! The hash browns on the side were lovely as well. 
Ok but really, this scramble was amazing. I wanna go again. Now. 
Oh but question: are the coffee refills free? I was afraid to ask.

excerpts: The breakfast choices are great-- had the egg white mediterreanean scramble with hash browns and a latte
and it was out of this world.
So much food that I had to take some home for later.
hash browns.author: Sonia S.
hash browns.review:
Why can't there be a similar place in good ol' SOMA?  Came in for breakfast early on a saturday morning when it was quiet and I could take my time reading the extensive menu.

The breakfast choices are great-- had the egg white mediterreanean scramble with hash browns and a latte and it was out of this world.  So much food that I had to take some home for later.  I like the layout and outdoor seating (although does the sun ever come out in lower haight?)  Next time I'm going for the breakfast burrito and french toast because they looked quite awesome. 

staff is friendly as well. I'm a fan.

excerpts: I ordered the breakfast sandwich with a side of hash browns.
I sure hit up the salt and paper shakers to spice up my hash browns.
They had run out of croissants, so my breakfast sandwich was scrambled eggs and bacon between to slices of toast.
I suppose I was hoping for something tasty and surprising, but all I got was a sandwich that I could have made at home.
Even the smoothie was a disappointment.
hash browns.author: Hugo C.
hash browns.review:
We were walking back from Haight-Ashbury and had to go -- really, really bad. We were at the point where we couldn't hold it any longer and The Grind Cafe was the closest restroom, so we decided to stop by and have a drink. We glanced over their menu and decided we might as well stop for lunch here.

I've become such a Yelp snob that I regularly don't eat at a place that I haven't at least read a couple of reviews on. Today was different though, I really had some bladder presser that needed relieving. The other half ordered a standard burger and a banana smoothie. I ordered the breakfast sandwich with a side of hash browns.

We found the food to be flavorless and uninspiring. I sure hit up the salt and paper shakers to spice up my hash browns. They had run out of croissants, so my breakfast sandwich was scrambled eggs and bacon between to slices of toast. I suppose I was hoping for something tasty and surprising, but all I got was a sandwich that I could have made at home. Even the smoothie was a disappointment. From the first sip you could tell that the banana was still unripened. 

It was a disappointing meal from start to finish.

excerpts: I ordered the ham scram with avocado, toast and hash browns.
Let me tell you, I inhaled everything.
I'd put some of the scram on my toast and it'd taste even better.
As always, staff was friendly and nice, atmosphere was chill, food was awesome.
hash browns.author: Laura F.
hash browns.review: I liked this place... another cool breakfast place within walking distance. I ordered the ham scram with avocado, toast and hash browns. Let me tell you, I inhaled everything. I'd put some of the scram on my toast and it'd taste even better. As always, staff was friendly and nice, atmosphere was chill, food was awesome.

excerpts: But the hash browns were meeh, the eggs were meah, the toast was a bit burn, but the vegi-sausage was AWESOME!!
But....
hash browns.author: Jessi K.
hash browns.review:
very torn between 2 and 3 stars...this place is not bad, the price is just about right for what it is, I was just not impressed.  

We came here on a Saturday, which might explain why it was so freaking busy.  After we ordered, we had to wait for a table to clear up, and we ended up bussing it ourselves.

I got a basic breakfast of eggs, toast, hashbrowns, and vegi-sausage patties.  I have to say, it's really nice that they have the meat alternatives...I'm not vegi or vegan or anything, I just really like certain vegi-patties (like the morning star ones...mmm...so good!) But the hash browns were meeh, the eggs were meah, the toast was a bit burn, but the vegi-sausage was AWESOME!!  But....BUT....lots of points because although it wasn't an impressive breakfast, it was EXACTLY what I wanted.  

We had gotten coffee earlier for the walk there, so we didn't order any at The Grind, and it seemed that everyone was more about beer drinking at 11:30 am on a Saturday, as opposed to coffee drinking.  We did get smoothies, and compared to other smoothies, I was disappointed.  (Check out the Mango Smoothie at the Moonlight Cafe in Bernal Heights...they cannot be beat!)   Also, extra points for the Grind for the fact that they offer a protein additive for the smoothies.  

All in all, I wouldn't make a point of coming back here, unless I were broke and wanting to go somewhere within walking distance from home to get breakfast.  It's also walking distance from a lot of neat places, and I believe there's probably cheap beer here.

excerpts: the french toast is huge and came with 6 pieces and your choice of home fries or hash browns ($6+change).
the corned beef hash is also pretty big and comes with two eggs your way...
hash browns.author: Sally T.
hash browns.review:
cute place with a decent patio for outdoor seating.

it's pretty much a coffee shop that serves meh food for cheap.  the french toast is huge and came with 6 pieces and your choice of home fries or hash browns ($6+change).  the corned beef hash is also pretty big and comes with two eggs your way...i'm not sure how much this was.

find your own seat, bus your own table.

not in a hurry to come back here unless every other breakfast place in town has a ridiculous wait time...

excerpts: All the breakfasts are really good and they have hash browns which seems more and more rare in this era of breakfast potatoes.
The spud variety is pretty great, they  even have curly fries.
Yay.
I also really like the poppy seed dressing with the side salad which is really fresh and crisp.
Oh and I love that there
juice and smoothies come in a big pint glass.
I just had their crispy chicken sandwich w avocado bacon and cheddar which was kind of blew me away.
My only complaint is they use chicken strips instead of a whole crispy chicken breast
but they got the flavor spot on.
hash browns.author: Ian S.
hash browns.review: This place Is my favorite cafe within miles.  The price is fair, the portions are pretty large and the food is delicious.  The variety is great too for lunch and breakfast which is available all day.  The French dip is awesome and I have a hard time wanting to get anything else but every time I get something different I love that too.  All the breakfasts are really good and they have hash browns which seems more and more rare in this era of breakfast potatoes.  The spud variety is pretty great, they  even have curly fries.  Yay.  I also really like the poppy seed dressing with the side salad which is really fresh and crisp.  Oh and I love that there juice and smoothies come in a big pint glass.   I just had their crispy chicken sandwich w avocado bacon and cheddar which was kind of blew me away.  My only complaint is they use chicken strips instead of a whole crispy chicken breast but they got the flavor spot on.

excerpts: For instance, their hash browns, scrambled eggs and toast are so-so, but their waffles and pancakes are delicious.
I've had just about everything on the breakfast menu and most of it is pretty decent.
This is a very typical breakfast place.
You can't really order veggie-meat products here as in other breakfast joints.
It has a nice front patio for warm days but it doesn't get much sunlight.
There is never a line out the door and the food is prepared pretty quickly.
hash browns.author: L. L.
hash browns.review:
I love the makeover! It's so nice and clean now. I don't have to feel ashamed to bring my mother-in-law here anymore. Some of the food is great and some is mediocre. For instance, their hash browns, scrambled eggs and toast are so-so, but their waffles and pancakes are delicious. I've had just about everything on the breakfast menu and most of it is pretty decent. This is a very typical breakfast place. You can't really order veggie-meat products here as in other breakfast joints. It has a nice front patio for warm days but it doesn't get much sunlight. There is never a line out the door and the food is prepared pretty quickly. This is a good place to bring a laptop and sit around for hours while sipping coffee.

Let me describe some of the best food I've had there:

Strawberry Waffle: 
One large waffle the size of a dinner plate, that was about 1" thick, with tons of fresh strawberries all over and sprinkled with powdered sugar. 

Home-fry Mound (I think they changed it to the Hash Mound): 
A large mound of potatoes smothered in melted cheddar, green onions, black olives, huge slabs of avocado and a dollop of sour cream. Very filling.

I think that with the makeover they made some changes I don't necessarily like all that much. I used to get fresh-squeezed grapefruit juice and they would squeeze it in front of me but now they serve it from a pitcher. The last time I had it it tasted pretty bad... like it was fermented.

Overall though, I give it a four because it's clean, has a patio, is close to home, the food is pretty good, they prepare it quickly, there is no line, and they offer many meal choices but most of all, their coffee doesn't suck.

excerpts: The hash browns are also good.
hash browns.author: Abhi S.
hash browns.review:
I don't think I expect much from brunch places - decent eggs, good hot sauce, great coffee and a relaxed atmosphere to start off a Saturday morning. 

Discovered the Grind and it didn't quite make the cut. The staff is friendly enough however the coffee is uninspired. I also seem destined to never get a croissant when I want a breakfast sandwish - interestingly, they are never, and I mean never, out of english muffins (how many times can you use the word never in a sentence?). This was also true at the Grind but a worthwhile substiution to sourdough was made.  The hash browns are also good. 

Sadly, the grind, like many brunch locations feels the need to optimize their space by seating 40 odd people in a space that should only take about 30-35. Bottom line: you're going to be very close to your neighboring table. As much as I like other people, I don't like them that much.,

excerpts: I'll keep enjoying The Grind's mound of hash browns and a sunny-side-up egg.
Wouldn't you?
hash browns.author: John S.
hash browns.review:
I really really really want to love this place.  I kind of do.  OK, that's not true.  

Have you ever dated a girl who was absolutely beautiful but who annoyed you nonetheless?  No, her beauty didn't annoy you, and it was natural, not a put-on or an example of masterful makeup artistry or a figment of your own delusionally hopeful imagination, but there just wasn't much else going on.  She could be smart and maybe even intelligent, but she wasn't quick on the uptake, or at least she didn't pick up on all the little cues that she should pick up on.  Those cues that you picked up on with her.  And maybe you enjoyed each other's company, but when you weren't physically together, you wondered whether you were just wasting your time with her?  And you had your breakup speech all planned out and maybe even rehearsed; you had chosen a coffeehouse or a park that you had never been to together so that neither of your memories or daily routines would be ruined by this ultimately trivial but nonetheless life-changing event?  But then when you saw her crossing the street in her cheap pink flip-flops or leaning down to pick a dandelion from the grass--and her hair would fall just so--you couldn't go through with it.  You just had to continue to be with this girl because she was beautiful, right?  Just really naturally pretty.  Someone no one in his right mind would give up.  Not without good reason?

Well, that girlfriend is The Grind Cafe.  It's gorgeous, and the menu is really promising.  The atmosphere is even pleasant, and this is an accomplishment in the Lower Haight.  But the food is just so bland.  It's not bad, and it's presented really beautifully, but on your walk home, you always find yourself wondering whether you should start spending less time here and more time at a grungier-looking restaurant that understands your needs better.

But hell, I'm a sucker for a pretty face, so I'll keep enjoying The Grind's mound of hash browns and a sunny-side-up egg.  Wouldn't you?

excerpts:
David Says: 
Well, the hash browns were edible--after I covered them in ketchup
hash browns.author: AmanDave H.
hash browns.review:
Amanda Says: 
Here's what I am wondering: How is it possible for food to taste like nothing? 

David Says: 
Well, the hash browns were edible--after I covered them in ketchup

Consensus: The Grind is The Gross. The food was cold and the tofu scramble was a sorry mess. If you are into "chalkboard restaurants" and live in the lower haight head on down to the Squat and Gobble. The house potatoes are at least edible and the Gobble knows a thing or two about tofu scramble.

excerpts: Came here on a Sunday morning for some breakfast and it was so damn tasty (can't go wrong with the breakfast burrito with a side of hash browns).
The service was friendly, the coffee was delicious, and its a very relaxed atmosphere.
Will certainly be back soon.
hash browns.author: Jeremy R.
hash browns.review: Came here on a Sunday morning for some breakfast and it was so damn tasty (can't go wrong with the breakfast burrito with a side of hash browns).  The service was friendly, the coffee was delicious, and its a very relaxed atmosphere.  Will certainly be back soon.

excerpts: The don't mess up simple things like an omelet and hash browns, but its not out of this world.
In such a foodie town, this is an okay place.
Since the prices aren't any cheaper than anywhere else Im surprised its so popular.
Last summer I did see Laura Linney and Ben Harper eating here, so thats a plus.
If you are really hung over it will do.
hash browns.author: Dana H.
hash browns.review: Yelp says that three starts is "A-OK", and that is exactly right. The Grind is okay. The don't mess up simple things like an omelet and hash browns, but its not out of this world. In such a foodie town, this is an okay place. Since the prices aren't any cheaper than anywhere else Im surprised its so popular. Last summer I did see Laura Linney and Ben Harper eating here, so thats a plus. If you are really hung over it will do.

excerpts: Get it with the hash browns and sourdough toast and then eat the latter with a little butter and a lot of blackberry jam
and you're all set!
Viva la breakfast!
hash browns.author: Christine P.
hash browns.review: I love The Grind Cafe. I live really close by and it's so nice to be able to walk over within a minute or two. The folks are always friendly and if you're a regular coffee drinker, they'll remember and offer you recommendations on what you might like to try. The Sister and I loved the granola with yogurt and fresh fruit. Ask for a little bit more yogurt when you order though. It comes with strawberries, blueberries and bananas and at the very end I like to mix in some honey (when all of the fruit except the bananas is gone). The coffee is mediocre but the scramblers are yummy. I like the Grind Scram. Get it with the hash browns and sourdough toast and then eat the latter with a little butter and a lot of blackberry jam and you're all set! Viva la breakfast!

excerpts: Both dishes come on a big plate, with a side of toast or muffin, and hash browns, salad, or fries.
We had the hash browns and they were great.
Service is friendly and in addition to the great menu, this place also is loaded with fine pastries, cookies, and more.
A great place for lunch or breakfast or just a quick cup of coffee!
hash browns.author: Beenish K.
hash browns.review: I love this place.  It has such a vast menu - something to please even the most picky eaters (which I know from personal experience, so trust me).  The vanilla latte is very good here, and I've been twice already for breakfast.  The veggie bagel with hummus and sprouts is positively delicious.  My husband and I had brunch there today and he enjoyed the lower haight omelet and I the tofu scram.  My husband commented that his omelet was "awesome" and completely cleaned off his plate.  The tofu scram was great, the first time I've tried it actually, and I think it's a great vegan-friendly dish, which is definitely hard to find.  Both dishes come on a big plate, with a side of toast or muffin, and hash browns, salad, or fries.  We had the hash browns and they were great.  Service is friendly and in addition to the great menu, this place also is loaded with fine pastries, cookies, and more.  A great place for lunch or breakfast or just a quick cup of coffee!

excerpts: Hash browns were insitutional fries (the kind you buy at Costco in 3-ton boxes), eggs were undercooked and watery, bread was lousy and under-butterred, cappucino was strange, and my stomach is in pain 2 hours later.
I would not return.
hash browns.author: Eater S.
hash browns.review: Just had breakfast there. Very disappointing. Hash browns were insitutional fries (the kind you buy at Costco in 3-ton boxes), eggs were undercooked and watery, bread was lousy and under-butterred, cappucino was strange, and my stomach is in pain 2 hours later. I would not return.

excerpts: I had the French Toast with Hash Browns and a side of scrambled egg, my man had the Corned Beef Hash on Toast.
I don't know how long it took altogether about an hour and a half, but for average food this was a really annoying experience.
The people were all nice and even fellow customers, it is tiny and it was new years, but come on guys pick up the pace a little!
hash browns.author: Sydney C.
hash browns.review:
I was here on new years day, my birthday! 
Had slept late at the hotel I will review on another page and needed food. This was my first time back in SF in almost 10 years and I was very excited to head for the Height section of the city, everyone is so creative and fun.
We were driving up towards Ashbury and this place looked so cute and friendly we just had to stop.
You go up to the counter and order then find a table on your own and sit. This is normally cool except there were no tables to sit at, for a half an hour. Which didn't matter I guess because we still hadn't been served by then. So we finally find one that has just been abandoned out on the patio and continue to wait another half hour or so for our food. 
I had the French Toast with Hash Browns and a side of scrambled egg, my man had the Corned Beef Hash on Toast. I don't know how long it took altogether about an hour and a half, but for average food this was a really annoying experience. 
The people were all nice and even fellow customers, it is tiny and it was new years, but come on guys pick up the pace a little!

excerpts: I ordered Hash Brown Hill from their "House Favorites" and it was a significant disappointment.
hash brown hill.author: Peter H.
hash brown hill.review:
This place is clean and fast and the coffee is decent and comes in nice big cups. Atmosphere is OK, you go up to the register to give your order and then they bring it to your table. 

I ordered Hash Brown Hill from their "House Favorites" and it was a significant disappointment. Instead of a "mound of hash browns" as promised, it was two connected pieces of flat pre-made style hash browns topped with cheese, with a portion of avocado and sour cream. To do the dish right you need to grate your own potatoes or at least buy the frozen shredded potatoes and then cook the hash browns griddle style so they come out loose and crispy, not like a flat, might-have-been-a-potatoe-but-is-now-just-a-sad-example-of-factory-produced-food dish.

excerpts: Their sandwiches are delicious, great French Toast and the Hash Brown Hill is to die for.
And they are always so sweet to us at the counter.
This place is solid.
hash brown hill.author: Elinor M.
hash brown hill.review: The Grind is our weekend ritual. The breakfast burrito -- with veggie sausage and hash browns and avocado, sans egg -- is the best one in the city. Their sandwiches are delicious, great French Toast and the Hash Brown Hill is to die for. And they are always so sweet to us at the counter. This place is solid.

excerpts: I went with the Grind Combo (Pancakes, hashbrowns, scrambled eggs, bacon).
grind combo.author: Brian S.
grind combo.review:
Not sure how I haven't reviewed the Grind before, seeing as how I grew up quite literally ACROSS THE STREET, but it's not like reviewing restaurants was the cool thing to do in middle school, so here we go. Better late than never.

I'll always been happy eating at The Grind if its convenient, because the menu is big, the food is solid, and you'll rarely, if ever, leave disappointed. But even after all these years, its still far from being one of my "favorite places". 

I went with the Grind Combo (Pancakes, hashbrowns, scrambled eggs, bacon). It was definitely satisfying, as you get your money's worth, but it was far from life-changing. 

Hashbrowns are dope. Crunchy, crispy, tasty and delicious. 

Pancakes are good, although they're a little heavy (as opposed to being light & fluffy), especially once you throw syrup on them. 

In short breakfast was as breakfast always is here, good, but not the best. Definitely think you can do better with Kate Kitchen or Eddie's Cafe, nearby options which are both slightly better. If I could give 3.5 stars I would in a heartbeat, but as it is 3 stars will have to do.

excerpts: " ( The Grind Combo, if you're wondering)
grind combo.author: Alyssa G.
grind combo.review:
Anytime I go out to breakfast, I consistently have the dilemma that I want French toast, but I also want the traditional breakfast of eggs, toast, and bacon. 

This place has that on one plate!

When my food arrived, my boyfriend took one look and said "Umm, next time I'm getting THAT." ( The Grind Combo, if you're wondering)

My latte was very good, and seriously their menu is huge and everything sounds really good. Plus the outdoor seating is where it's at.

Oh and the staff is actually FRIENDLY. A smile while taking your order goes a long way.

excerpts: Second day, I had the Grind Combo (I believe that's what it's called),
and although it wasn't a fancy order at all, everything was quite tasty.
The french toast was quite good, which is impressive because I think most places overdo it with the egg then cover them in powdered sugar like we're at Cafe du Monde or something.
This place did them quite nicely.
grind combo.author: Edgar S.
grind combo.review:
First of all, lemme preface this with my "I don't drink coffee" disclaimer and tell you right now, I have NO idea if the coffee here is worth your time because... well... I don't drink coffee. 

Now, moving on to what's important... FOOD.

I ate breakfast here twice in the two days I was in town. Day one, I got the breakfast sandwich (egg, sausage & cheese on a croissant) which you can pretty much customize to have whatever you want. That's pretty hard to mess up since it's got exactly what you want on it but it was quite tasty. The hash browns are also quite yummy.

Second day, I had the Grind Combo (I believe that's what it's called), and although it wasn't a fancy order at all, everything was quite tasty. The french toast was quite good, which is impressive because I think most places overdo it with the egg then cover them in powdered sugar like we're at Cafe du Monde or something. This place did them quite nicely. The country potatoes were also good. 

I also must say this about the staff; they are really nice. They may be granola-crunching hippies (let's face it, they're everywhere around here) but they were super sweet and very quick with the drinks and the food.

excerpts: Grind Combo with French Toast (holla for the Challah) and home fries.
grind combo.author: Naeem N.
grind combo.review:
The Grind is my home office and favored Lower Haight eatery.  Good food, good pricing and a comfortable place make it a must for me everyday.  The staff is uber friendly and they are always smiling (Andrea and C-Sha and Smashly are da best).  

Free and reliable wi-fi, well placed power outlets, breakfast and burgers, chili and smoothies, home made iced tea and lemonade and coffee make it even better.  Busiest times are lunchtime and weekend brunch (damn you Kaiser!)

Open until 8PM during the week.  Current new discovery has been the chili oddly enough.  Ole Reliable dish:  Grind Combo with French Toast (holla for the Challah) and home fries.

excerpts:
The GRIND Combo: 2 eggs, hash, sausage or bacon, french toast or pancakes

Boy:
grind combo.author: Oanh N.
grind combo.review:
The GRIND Combo: 2 eggs, hash, sausage or bacon, french toast or pancakes

Boy: Can I have your sausage
Girl: Can I have some of your corn beef hash
Boy: Mmm my corn beef hash is good
Girl: best french toast ever
Boy: this breakfast is good. the hash isn't greasy 
Girl: I can't believe I just finished my plate

Expect a long wait for the food. 
Patio seating is available and is dog friendly :)

excerpts: Try the grind combo for the big man in all of us.
If you give them a bad review because you don't like the hamburger you got then try something else before giving them 2 stars.
Also the grind is about a million times better than any Crepeville baloney.
grind combo.author: Mister L.
grind combo.review: This place is awesome.  If you have a bad experience then go back again and try something else.  They are so fast even when the line is out the door which is a tell tale sign that this place is doing things right.   I typically go here for breakfast which is always cooked to perfection.  I look for consistency in the places I eat and The Grind never fails.  Try the grind combo for the big man in all of us.  If you give them a bad review because you don't like the hamburger you got then try something else before giving them 2 stars.  Also the grind is about a million times better than any Crepeville baloney.

excerpts: The breakfast burrito and grind combo are my favorites.
So good
I have to stop myself from going there more.
Here's the deal, it's a very good place to grab food, be it brunch, a burger,
a salad...whatever.
Since the remodel, it appears that their kitchen capacity has improved dramatically too.
The complaints I'm seeing on here about "poor service" and "inefficiencies" are baffling to me.
Common Sense.
If there is a line out the door, all the tables look full, and there are people waiting for to go orders....
It's gonna take a while to get your food on a Saturday or Sunday morning.
You are talking about a very clean place with above average, fairly priced food in very popular part of SF.
There are too many bad ones to count.
This isn't the place you go "to brunch.
It's where you go because you don't want to deal with the bs that is "brunching"  but want the same or similar quality food.
grind combo.author: Paul Z.
grind combo.review: I'm reading some of these reviews and they are ridiculous. I live down the street and come to the Grind at least once or twice a week. The breakfast items are great. The breakfast burrito and grind combo are my favorites. So good I have to stop myself from going there more. Here's the deal, it's a very good place to grab food, be it brunch, a burger, a salad...whatever. Since the remodel, it appears that their kitchen capacity has improved dramatically too. The complaints I'm seeing on here about "poor service" and "inefficiencies" are baffling to me. Common Sense. If there is a line out the door, all the tables look full, and there are people waiting for to go orders....It's gonna take a while to get your food on a Saturday or Sunday morning. You are talking about a very clean place with above average, fairly priced food in very popular part of SF. There are too many bad ones to count. This isn't the place you go "to brunch." It's where you go because you don't want to deal with the bs that is "brunching"  but want the same or similar quality food. Having been here too many times to count, I have to say it's got to be the most consistent place in the Lower Haight. Can't wait to go back again!

excerpts: They do a solid burger and the Grind Combo is a hangover cure from heaven - eggs, sausage or bacon, pancakes or French toast, what's not to like.
So the omelets are a bit rubbery but dude this ain't Paris and the portions are grand.
And it's big enough that you have a chance of getting breakfast without waiting a lifetime at the weekends.
grind combo.author: mefloquine x.
grind combo.review: God bless you, The Grind. You're 50 meters from my house and you never let me down. The staff are lovely, the food is not out of this world but it does the job and sometimes a bit more. I've eaten here a hundred times and maybe only once been disappointed. They do a solid burger and the Grind Combo is a hangover cure from heaven - eggs, sausage or bacon, pancakes or French toast, what's not to like. So the omelets are a bit rubbery but dude this ain't Paris and the portions are grand. And it's big enough that you have a chance of getting breakfast without waiting a lifetime at the weekends.

excerpts: I also split a short stack with my friend.
For a drink, "Orange juice, and lots of it, please.
The wait staff was perky, chipper and did not at all look amused... or hungover.

Really good, actually, and the short stack reminded me of home, so damn that's gotta be worth at least one star... and the eggs were yummy and there was ample hot sauce at the table (although just Tabasco...
when will people get it
right?
ANYTHING but Tabasco!), and
pretty soon I was happy and full, and I didn't have to give up 30 minutes sitting on the curb waiting for a table (that's you, Porkstore...
short stack.author: Aiden B.
short stack.review:
The Grind is not exactly what I expected when a friend of mine suggested we have brunch in the Lower Haight. I was stoked for the idea of a divey, nasty, greasy spoon with an assertive, short-tempered wait staff that had been working there for a decade.

So I approach the place from the west, slowly, sizing it up; looks alright, so far. I see hipsters and students and art kids smoking on the patio. This is usually a good sign, at least for my tastes and general comfort level.

Once inside, however, surprise! Exposed duct work, track lighting and the ubiquitous gigantic fucking chalk board menu. The offerings looked good, though, so I chose to forgive them and let bygones be bygones while some coked out dude started yammering at my friend.

I ordered the two eggs, scram, with hash and subbed an English muffin  for the toast. I also split a short stack with my friend. For a drink, "Orange juice, and lots of it, please." The wait staff was perky, chipper and did not at all look amused... or hungover. This was a problem.

But the food was good. Really good, actually, and the short stack reminded me of home, so damn that's gotta be worth at least one star... and the eggs were yummy and there was ample hot sauce at the table (although just Tabasco... when will people get it right? ANYTHING but Tabasco!), and pretty soon I was happy and full, and I didn't have to give up 30 minutes sitting on the curb waiting for a table (that's you, Porkstore... that's what you sound like).

So, damnit, a reluctant 3... but well earned. Even if it did feel like Hayes Valley in there.

excerpts: The banana walnut pancakes are yummy.
Nice and friendly cashier.
It is a nice place to hang out over coffee and/or beers and read.
I like the outdoor seating.
banana walnut.author: J M.
banana walnut.review: The banana walnut pancakes are yummy.  Nice and friendly cashier.  It is a nice place to hang out over coffee and/or beers and read.  I like the outdoor seating.

excerpts: Although next time I'm getting the Nutella Madness - buttermilk pancakes with bananas and nutella, YUM!
nutella madness.author: Meghan C.
nutella madness.review: Great spot for a laid-back weekend brunch. It was fairly busy (a good sign, I always say) but we were able to snag a table on the patio and people watch while we waited for our food. I had the Haight scramble (bacon, avacado, green onion, cheddar) with home fries and my husband had a Belgian waffle with a side of bacon, and everything was delicious. Will definitely be back. Although next time I'm getting the Nutella Madness - buttermilk pancakes with bananas and nutella, YUM!

excerpts: Killer croissant french toast.
Desserts yo die for, try the lemon bread (cake).
Staff is cool, I'm a fan - just do it.
croissant french toast.author: Christian C.
croissant french toast.review: Cool place to chill and have brunch.  Killer croissant french toast.  Desserts yo die for, try the lemon bread (cake).   Staff is cool, I'm a fan - just do it.

excerpts: The coffee is decent, as is the croissant french toast, but their scrambles are greasy and their regular french toast is bland and soggy.
Eat here if you're starving and need a quick fix
but if you want a good breakfast/brunch you're better off finding another spot in the city.
Maven, Kate's Kitchen, and NOPA are all within walking distance and offer far superior brunches.
croissant french toast.author: Chriselle B.
croissant french toast.review: This place used to serve food that was worth the price but the quality has declined significantly in the last few months. The coffee is decent, as is the croissant french toast, but their scrambles are greasy and their regular french toast is bland and soggy. Eat here if you're starving and need a quick fix but if you want a good breakfast/brunch you're better off finding another spot in the city. Maven, Kate's Kitchen, and NOPA are all within walking distance and offer far superior brunches.

excerpts: If you like a sweet breakfast, treat yourself with the croissant french toast!
croissant french toast.author: Eli P.
croissant french toast.review:
I will begin this review by stating that I think the issues some people have with this place could be alleviated if everyone bussed their own table after they finish eating - the bins are over by the cooking area - do the next person after you a favor and clean up after yourself!

The Grind is an excellent breakfast spot in the Haight. Some items are better than others. For example, you get a potato option with a few items, always get the home fries (otherwise you get french fries or unimpressive hash browns). The homefries are real chopped potatoes with some veggies! The omelets and scram dishes are yummy! I love the Haight Scram. The egg sandwich is surprisingly good too (choose the english muffin as your bread and see). If you like a sweet breakfast, treat yourself with the croissant french toast!

Coffee is basic and good - they also have great smoothies. Overall, a nice place. It can get super busy, with a line going out the door. I always have a moment where I freak out and think I won't get a seat by the time I order, but that's yet to happen. Sometimes I come alone and bring a book to read while I finish my coffee, great place to do this :)

I think you  may be able to fit up to a group of 6 here, if you squish some tables together - just keep in mind you order at the counter.

excerpts: The Haight scram is a favorite, also the croissant french toast, and the amazing orange juice!
croissant french toast.author: Jennifer H.
croissant french toast.review:
This is a regular stop for me (once or twice a week) for a quiet place to sit and read, while eating some tasty food stuffs. 
The Haight scram is a favorite, also the croissant french toast, and the amazing orange juice! 

Prices are good for the portion sizes, and the staff is always very nice and accommodating. 
Definitely will continue to be my "go-to" until I move out of the lower Haight.

excerpts: I went with the croissant french toast, a couple of scrambled eggs and a glass of apple juice.
The juice seemed natural with that darker, cloudier look rather than that pretty almost clear stuff you get in a bottle at Safeway.
Eggs cooked to perfection, though I could have used some shredded cheese on top.
French toast was a couple of big croissants sliced in two and cooked in the classic batter.
All very good.
croissant french toast.author: Bennett L.
croissant french toast.review:
Sundays are my Fridays and working the overnight shift, Sunday mornings are my Friday nights.  (Are you following?)  So what else to do on a "Friday night" but go grab a bite on the town.  By town I mean an emerging from slumber, cloudy San Francisco.  By bite I mean breakfast, naturally.

There was a sports bar I wanted to check out for some NFL action in the area, so luckily I also came across The Grind Cafe to get my fill ahead of time.  This place is a hub of activity on a Sunday morning.  Families with their kids, students with their notebooks, young adults knocking out the cobwebs, SFPD officers on their break and guys like me just looking for something new.  A patchwork of people coexisting in a big city.

This is one of those places where you pay in advance and then they bring you your food.  You might want to study the menu ahead of time.  It's vast and you can feel rushed trying to decide what to get at the counter with a steady line of folks behind you.

I went with the croissant french toast, a couple of scrambled eggs and a glass of apple juice.  The juice seemed natural with that darker, cloudier look rather than that pretty almost clear stuff you get in a bottle at Safeway.  Eggs cooked to perfection, though I could have used some shredded cheese on top.  French toast was a couple of big croissants sliced in two and cooked in the classic batter.  All very good.  It's not too cheap but you can get what you need with less than $20 in your pocket.

I'd definitely come back here and try some other stuff on the menu.  Friendly service and a definite neighborhood feel.  Plenty of tv's tuned to NFL pre-game show too, so that's always a plus.

excerpts: Huge amazing delicious menu full of scrumptious options from omelets and scrambles to all types of sandwiches and salads, croissant French Toast and peanut butter and banana bagel.
croissant french toast.author: Uriah B.
croissant french toast.review:
This place is indeed, As good as it gets! Huge amazing delicious menu full of scrumptious options from omelets and scrambles to all types of sandwiches and salads, croissant French Toast and peanut butter and banana bagel.

The portions are generous and everything is properly made. The sandwiches are loaded with meat and fixings (nothing worse the a skimpy sandwich) as is everything else. They have great coffee, drinks and amazing looking pastries and snacks. 

This is a perfect place for a great breakfast or lunch with friends and everything is reasonably priced (nothing over $10)

excerpts: My favorite is the croissant french toast.
Yes, you read that right.
croissant french toast.author: Jenny J.
croissant french toast.review:
I really like this place. It may be that it's so close to my house, but I absolutely love it. The food isn't going to knock your socks off, but it's pretty good. My favorite is the croissant french toast. Yes, you read that right. I'll give you a second to ponder and recover.

Even though this place is usually pretty crowded, wait it out and be like a panther - You can find a spot.

excerpts: I had a bite of my friend's croissant french toast and if I was walking 50 miles a week
like she does I would have eaten the entire plate!
The food here is solid.
Great atmosphere...especially on a 420 weekend!
croissant french toast.author: Sherie R.
croissant french toast.review: Nothing to be upset about here. The staff is friendly and very kind. We had breakfast here this morning on the patio...with doggies too and it was super fun! I had the Scott Street Omelette----pretty darn good and huge. I had a bite of my friend's croissant french toast and if I was walking 50 miles a week like she does I would have eaten the entire plate! The food here is solid. Great atmosphere...especially on a 420 weekend!

excerpts: I fell in love with their croissant french toast.
Adding fresh strawberries to it made it really delicious.
croissant french toast.author: John S.
croissant french toast.review:
First time experience.

This is my favorite breakfast spot to eat at when I'm staying at the Metro Hotel.
My girlfriend and I visited this place a few times during our stay in San Francisco.
I fell in love with their croissant french toast. Adding fresh strawberries to it made it really delicious. I chose to get their homestyle fries instead of the hash browns. The homestyle fries were decent.
I also went with their lattes. Coffee is made fairly quick, before your food is brought out to you. Food is made fairly quickly and brought out to you by friendly staff.
Overall the staff is friendly and are quick to serve you.
The atmosphere is somewhat quiet to average noise levels.
The place also has large windows which brings in great ambient light.
It's a great place to sit down and eat so you can enjoy your morning.
There is free wi-fi but limited on the weekends.
This place is very convenient if you're staying at the Metro Hotel. Just a short walk away.
Prices are fair for what you receive.

The Grind Cafe is our favorite new place for breakfast.
But will also continue to come back to try their lunch menu.

excerpts: Cinnamon and nutmeg and vanilla drenched croissant French toast!
To die for.
Sat next to some really annoying kids though, one of the girls was such a down-and-out aspiring actress who couldn't get a break (boo-hoo).
The trio made repeated loud pronouncements about the merits or demerits of LA vs San Francisco and Franklin Village and...argh...ruined my digestion.
But that's not The Grind Cafe's fault is it?
Moral of the story: order that f'in croissant french toast...now.
croissant french toast.author: Delan B.
croissant french toast.review: Cinnamon and nutmeg and vanilla drenched croissant French toast!  To die for.  Sat next to some really annoying kids though, one of the girls was such a down-and-out aspiring actress who couldn't get a break (boo-hoo).  The trio made repeated loud pronouncements about the merits or demerits of LA vs San Francisco and Franklin Village and...argh...ruined my digestion.  But that's not The Grind Cafe's fault is it?  Moral of the story: order that f'in croissant french toast...now.

excerpts: Croissant French toast and breakfast burritos rock.
The cooks are rad too!!
croissant french toast.author: Gabriel N.
croissant french toast.review: Valicia and Ashley rock. Croissant French toast and breakfast burritos rock. The cooks are rad too!!

excerpts: It has a standard brunch menu that includes croissant french toast.
Lots of people sit in the outdoor area with there
dogs
so I like taking my golden retriever here for brunches.
Sometimes the food comes out a little slowly or they mess up your order a little or the line is a little long but nothing too dramatic has ever happened to me.
Good standard brunch place.
croissant french toast.author: barbara b.
croissant french toast.review: This is my go-to local brunch place.  It has a standard brunch menu that includes croissant french toast.  Lots of people sit in the outdoor area with there dogs so I like taking my golden retriever here for brunches.  Sometimes the food comes out a little slowly or they mess up your order a little or the line is a little long but nothing too dramatic has ever happened to me.  Good standard brunch place.

excerpts: The French burger with skinny fries lightly toasted on a French bread.......yum!!!
Pair that with a sweet chai latte
and I'm then ready for my post grind nap....
best burger eva!!!
french burger.author: Kirsty E.
french burger.review: Aaaaaah the grind, one of my favorite neighborhood haunts. The French burger with skinny fries lightly toasted on a French bread.......yum!!! Pair that with a sweet chai latte and I'm then ready for my post grind nap....best burger eva!!!

excerpts: I ordered the French Burger with fries and found it to be okay
but nothing noteworthy.
The french fries were decent
but I think it was a poor choice to order this variation of a hamburger as the addition of french bread makes for a heavier meal.
I couldn't finish the other half of my sandwich.
My friends who brought me here both days highly endorse the French Dip as being the best in the city.
I'll have to give this place another go-round and find out if that's true.
french burger.author: Jill D.
french burger.review:
This was a tough weekend.  By "tough" I mean mostly sleepless.  I did every debaucherous thing I possibly could and took bodily abuse to new levels.  It was fabulous!  At several points, however, I realized that my body needed nourishment.  As different groups of friends suggested eating here, I had the opportunity to dine two days in a row.  Day one saw me and a hot Austrian trying to force our e-xhausted bodies to consume nourishment.  He managed an orange banana smoothie while I was able to choke down the Pear Salad and some coffee.  I have to say that this was a super tasty salad and largely proportioned with a generous side of fresh sourdough.  Best of all, I survived to roll on to the Polk Street Fair!
Day two saw me roll in after a terribly strung out night after the Polk Street Festival which saw me greet the day at 7:30am before calling it a night.  I ordered the French Burger with fries and found it to be okay but nothing noteworthy.  The french fries were decent but I think it was a poor choice to order this variation of a hamburger as the addition of french bread makes for a heavier meal.  I couldn't finish the other half of my sandwich.
My friends who brought me here both days highly endorse the French Dip as being the best in the city.  I'll have to give this place another go-round and find out if that's true.

excerpts: I had the BBQ Bacon Burger and it was OK and not very big.
My wife had the Turkey Burger and I would say the same thing.
Neither were very juicy or had great flavor either.
I got mine with the Garlic Fries, while my wife had the Spicy Curly Fries.
I think the Spicy Curly Fries are much better.
The Garlic Fries are small, matchstick fries which aren't bad, just nothing very special.
bbq bacon burger.author: Scott L.
bbq bacon burger.review:
My wife and I went here for lunch and I was torn as to what rating to give them.  Based solely on the food I would only give them a two or three star rating.  I had the BBQ Bacon Burger and it was OK and not very big.  My wife had the Turkey Burger and I would say the same thing.  Neither were very juicy or had great flavor either.  I got mine with the Garlic Fries, while my wife had the Spicy Curly Fries.  I think the Spicy Curly Fries are much better.  The Garlic Fries are small, matchstick fries which aren't bad, just nothing very special.  Because the fries are so small they don't do a very good job or holding the garlic seasoning.

So, why did I give them three stars?  The people who work here are all very nice and it was one of the few places in the area where you can sit outside.  I was great to sit outside on a nice day and eat with our dog.  All the deserts look wonderful too.

excerpts: I'd recommend the pear salad.
Fries are separate from the burger.
I was disappointed with the fry portion.
I ate them in probably two bites :( .
They have wifi here.
Nice spot.
I've had luck with parking here.
I would recommend it.
It's a bit pricey though.
$12 for a sandwich.
$12 for a salad
pear salad.author: Kevin S.
pear salad.review:
The food here is pretty tasty. Everything has great flavor. I had the chicken pesto sandwich and really liked it. Their salads are good too. I'd recommend the pear salad. 
Fries are separate from the burger. I was disappointed with the fry portion. I ate them in probably two bites :( .
They have wifi here. 
Nice spot. I've had luck with parking here.
I would recommend it. It's a bit pricey though. $12 for a sandwich. $12 for a salad

excerpts: There was a LIVE cockroach, having a field day in the pear salad.
Do order in nor to go.
This place doesn't deserve people's hard earned money.
pear salad.author: Connie C.
pear salad.review: This place is disgusting! There was a LIVE cockroach, having a field day in the pear salad. Do order in nor to go. This place doesn't deserve people's hard earned money.

excerpts: I order a pear salad, honey mustard dressing on side.
pear salad.author: Karley A.
pear salad.review: Wow. What a joke this place is. Stood in line for 40 minutes. Right when we got to the front, one register broke. How convenient. Now we wait longer because only one person manning the second register. At this point we decided to just get the food to go. I order a pear salad, honey mustard dressing on side. Husband orders veggie melt. More waiting. I see our take out food just sitting on the counter and wait some more. No one gave it us until I asked. Phew, get me out of here already. Go to the car. Open up the food...salad, no honey mustard dressing. Veggie melt...let's just say it looked worse than jail food. They wouldn't even serve this at the fyre festival. The cheese came out of a cheese wiz can. Biggest joke of a place and waste of money. Oh, bring blue bottle to the lower haight :)

excerpts: (though I usually end up with a scram), the pear salad with tuna, the eggplant sandwich, the Reuben.
pear salad.author: Shahrzad K.
pear salad.review:
How I haven't written a review yet is beyond me.  The Grind has been my reliable, go-to spot for the last 5 years since moving to SF (it certainly helps practically living upstairs).  When I was working, I'd stop in more frequently for coffee on my way out. It's usually the first meal I eat after returning from any vacation and not having food in the fridge.  I even find myself coming here after I've gone grocery shopping and unpacked the massive load of food (in efforts to reduce my eating out habits) and not having the energy to cook. 

Faves on the menu --  all breakfast items (though I usually end up with a scram), the pear salad with tuna, the eggplant sandwich, the Reuben. One roommate loves the bfast burritos. 

Lines can get a bit long on the weekends, but if you order to go or just want a quick coffee/drink, they now have a 2nd register closer to the kitchen where you can bypass the line.

excerpts: Sure the chicken-pesto sandwich and the pear salad are spectacular.
The coffee is good, the choice of chai options is refreshing.
pear salad.author: Ravena F.
pear salad.review:
Sure the chicken-pesto sandwich and the pear salad are spectacular.  The coffee is good, the choice of chai options is refreshing.
But the real prize here are the staff.

Because of its close proximity to the hospital, we bring rehab patients here on a regular basis to practice speech, swallowing, calculation, walking with a cane, wheelchair mobility . . . and much more.  Rather than being impatient, awkward or otherwise inappropriate, the staff here are pleasant, normal and manage to do their part to make every interaction as seamless as possible.  They act like it's the most natural thing in the world to watch someone write down their order or point to it on the paper menu simply because the person can't verbalize the order. 

Now, perhaps your thinking c'mon, who would be rude to someone with obvious speech difficulties?  Or mobility issues?  Or pragmatics and weird eye movement problems?  Sadly, the answer is: plenty of people!  You might be amazed to observe how completely wrapped up in their own days people can be to ignore or even despise the struggles of a fellow human.  Fortunately, those people do not work at The Grind.  Instead, this has become the perfect trial run destination for our patients tentatively emerging from the protective environment of the hospital.

Thanks for that people.  And thanks for the fresh, healthy food - a divinity inspired meal for someone who's been eating hospital food for weeks on end.  And a better-than-average breakfast/lunch for the rest of us.

excerpts: The staff are very friendly, the salads are excellent (try the pear salad with cranberries and blue cheese!).
pear salad.author: Corey C.
pear salad.review:
Finally went to The Grind Cafe for a day of work, and I was happy!  The staff are very friendly, the salads are excellent (try the pear salad with cranberries and blue cheese!).

It straddles the line between cafe and restaurant pretty well.  The wifi is kind of sketchy, but there are a few outlets you can nab for your laptop.

excerpts: my favorites are the pear salad or the veggie (kind of a redundant name
but you know..
) salad.
pear salad.author: gina s.
pear salad.review:
i see that most people who have reviewed the grind talk about the coffee and breakfasts but i'm here to tell all of you that the salads are amazing.

seriously, unless you go to a sit down place, i think it is hard to find a reseasonably priced salads that use super fresh ingrediants. look no more, the grind has come to the rescue. my favorites are the pear salad or the veggie (kind of a redundant name but you know..) salad. and of course i add grilled chicken which is always tender and cooked to order.

on top of this, i've found the staff to be outgoing and friendly. thank you, the grind!

excerpts: The food is solid and I especially enjoy the Pear Salad when I want to feel a little healthier than I normally am.
This is the spot that I enjoy thoroughly because it is so close to my house.
There are certainly better spots for breakfast in the city but The Grind holds a special place in my heart.
pear salad.author: N S.
pear salad.review: This place is reliable. I love the chicks who work there. They are cute and funny. The food is solid and I especially enjoy the Pear Salad when I want to feel a little healthier than I normally am. This is the spot that I enjoy thoroughly because it is so close to my house. There are certainly better spots for breakfast in the city but The Grind holds a special place in my heart.

excerpts: I had the BLTA on toasted sourdough with fries which really hit the spot.
The food was great and the employees we're very friendly.
I checked out the food that other people had sitting around us.
It all looked very appetizing;  burgers, salads, bagels, breakfast, gormet coffees, teas.
I have no idea why anybody would give this place less than 3 stars even if they were having a bad day.
blta.author: Donna P.
blta.review: We were looking for a place to eat near CPMC (hospital). We were pleasantly surprised with this place. My aunt had the Scott Street Omlett and they did not skimp on the filling. My mom had a Belgium waffel with strawberries/bananas drizzled with Nutella which was presented beautifully. I had the BLTA on toasted sourdough with fries which really hit the spot. The food was great and the employees we're very friendly. I checked out the food that other people had sitting around us. It all looked very appetizing;  burgers, salads, bagels, breakfast, gormet coffees, teas. I have no idea why anybody would give this place less than 3 stars even if they were having a bad day.

excerpts: Wow had a BLTA on sourdough yummy!
The fries are incredible.
Courteous staff and clean restaurant.
blta.author: Jill L.
blta.review: Wow had a BLTA on sourdough yummy! The fries are incredible. Courteous staff and clean restaurant.

excerpts: The staff are uniformly friendly and welcoming, the food is great - try the BLTA - and filling, and the coffee, chai, and the spiced cider are just wonderful and inexpensive!
blta.author: Michael S.
blta.review:
Lower Haight. A great neighborhood, and a great café.

The staff are uniformly friendly and welcoming, the food is great - try the BLTA - and filling, and the coffee, chai, and the spiced cider are just wonderful and inexpensive!

Plentiful and fast Wi-Fi.

The only downside is it's on the wrong side of the street, so it never gets warmed by the sunlight. I guess this is a plus on sweltering days, but somewhat daunting on those frosty ones. Or don't be dumb (like I am) and stop sitting outside. But I like sitting outside, watching the parade of humanity march by...

excerpts: House blend Coffee was so good and the price was very reasonable.
house blend.author: JC M.
house blend.review:
Delicious, worth the price!

House blend Coffee was so good and the price was very reasonable.

Had Acropolis omelette with home fries and sourdough. Highly recommended for any vegetarian. 

Hubby had breakfast sandwich with bacon and eggs and French fries and said it was delicious.

excerpts: The coffee is fantastic, and the caramel latte deserves 5 stars.
Unfortunately, I had two bad experiences with the service here
5 star visit my first time when I had a caramel latte and the Haight scramble with bacon, avocado, and green onions; both were delicious.
caramel latte.author: Meg R.
caramel latte.review:
While in SF, I stayed right around the corner from this little café. Due to its convenient location, I visited a handful of times. The coffee is fantastic, and the caramel latte deserves 5 stars. Unfortunately, I had two bad experiences with the service here so I have to say it's a 3 star spot. 

5 star visit my first time when I had a caramel latte and the Haight scramble with bacon, avocado, and green onions; both were delicious. 

1 star visit the next time I came when I ordered an egg and cheese sandwich on an English muffin, was given an egg and cheese sandwich on a croissant, and the staff would not revise my order for some reason when I asked. I ended up scraping off the egg and cheese because I hate croissants and confrontation. 

2 stars on the third visit because I ordered a bagel with cream cheese to go and ended up waiting 15 minutes for it.

excerpts: But to provide my yummy bagel with company, I usually pair it with a caramel latte.
OMFG.
I'll say it again:
OMFG!!!!!
BEST CARAMEL LATTE EVER!!!!!!!!!
Starbucks, who?
Coffee Bean, what?!
No longer.
It is ALL about the caramel latte.
It's nice and sweet, but not too sweet.
Very creamy.
Sure my stomach is rumbling an hour after I finish it, but chalk that up to my lactose intolerance.
Yes.
I will suffer the effects of bloating and stomach gurgling to indulge in this latte.
Soooo worth it.
But one day I switched it up and ordered their mango smoothie.
I just KNEW
it was gonna be good since it took them, like, 5 minutes to make.
And there's nothing more annoying then getting a smoothie that melts while it's in your hands or you can drink in its entirety in 3 minutes.
My first suck from the straw produced a frown and various veins bulging from my forehead.
This smoothie was THICK and JUICY and SWEET and good!
I'm big on drink-to-food ratio
so this accompanied my bagel perfectly.
I don't know why I've never had lunch there.
I mean I actually go during lunch and just opt for my bagel.
But if it's any consolation, I've gone with friends who have the audacity to order lunch during lunchtime and it always looks scrumptious.
I feel like I should give 5 stars alone for just the damn bagel, latte, and smoothie.
I mean if a restaurant is making me convulse with those random things then how much more for an actual meal?!
Contrary to other yelpers, I've never had a run in with a snooty cashier or anything like that, thank God.
I'm not one to hold my tongue if someone is giving me attitude for no damn reason.
The service has always been great, albeit a tad slow.
But other than that, I love this place.
It also seems like a great neighborhood hangout with locals.
