excerpts: I just stopped here for a quick bite of a pastry and some iced tea.
The ginger peach iced tea was especially refreshing, and I had free refills too.
I had a good couple of pastries: a raspberry bar and a lemon cake.
iced.author: Molly M.
iced.review:
I just stopped here for a quick bite of a pastry and some iced tea. The ginger peach iced tea was especially refreshing, and I had free refills too. I had a good couple of pastries: a raspberry bar and a lemon cake. I can't vouch for any of their other food, but what I tried was pretty good. 

I also like the vibe of the place. It was very open, with lots of light, and it had almost a cafeteria feel. There were several people there working on their laptops or having coffee in the mid-afternoon.

excerpts: Iced coffee and regular coffee- not bad!
However if you want whipped cream they do not have the proper lids for them!
iced.author: Rox N.
iced.review:
My new favorite spot for lunch! They have a little bit of everything for everyone. I've been here now a handful of times. You have the option to sit inside or outside patio which is great. Service is awesome always quick. 


Cobb salad- generous portion and taste amazing! (However ask for the dressing on the side)

Chinese chicken salad- two thumbs up! 

Chicken Ceasar- good but a bit over dressed. 

Patty melt- delish 

Garlic fries- they're ok, nothing like the ball park. 

Blueberry crumb cake- fresh and to die for.

Smoothies- Meh, a tab bit over priced. 

Iced coffee and regular coffee- not bad! However if you want whipped cream they do not have the proper lids for them!

excerpts: However I was disappointed with the iced coffee when I ordered it; it didn't seem very fresh.
iced.author: Daniel P.
iced.review:
I come here once a week or so for breakfast and coffee when I work from home.

The espresso drinks are pretty good here, as is their hot drop coffee. However I was disappointed with the iced coffee when I ordered it; it didn't seem very fresh.

The food can be pretty hit or miss. I am a huge fan of eggs benedict, and theirs is certainly passable, albeit not spectacular. They poach eggs pretty well, but their hollandaise sauce is sometimes on the tangy side for me, and they don't use very much. Their Denver omelet is quite good!

The staff are always down to earth and friendly.

excerpts: Free and reliable wi-fi, well placed power outlets, breakfast and burgers, chili and smoothies, home made iced tea and lemonade and coffee make it even better.
iced.author: Naeem N.
iced.review:
The Grind is my home office and favored Lower Haight eatery.  Good food, good pricing and a comfortable place make it a must for me everyday.  The staff is uber friendly and they are always smiling (Andrea and C-Sha and Smashly are da best).  

Free and reliable wi-fi, well placed power outlets, breakfast and burgers, chili and smoothies, home made iced tea and lemonade and coffee make it even better.  Busiest times are lunchtime and weekend brunch (damn you Kaiser!)

Open until 8PM during the week.  Current new discovery has been the chili oddly enough.  Ole Reliable dish:  Grind Combo with French Toast (holla for the Challah) and home fries.

excerpts: However, you can find a tofu scramble, some hummus and bagel type offerings, as well as soy and almond milk on the menu.
almond milk.author: Jon T.
almond milk.review:
The Grind is a long-standing institution of Lower Haight. Even today, with the influx of some new businesses further east on Haight St, the Grind is still one of the only places that is reliable for all your coffee, tea, and breakfast needs. 

As a vegan, there is unfortunately not a whole lot of options at your disposal. However, you can find a tofu scramble, some hummus and bagel type offerings, as well as soy and almond milk on the menu. I believe they also occasionally have some vegan baked good selections, although I didn't see any last time I was there.

Although the vegan options aren't stellar, it's about on par with most of the rest of the neighborhood (or even SF, for that matter.) But I personally really appreciate that they have a large selection of teas. For some reason, it's rather difficult to find hot tea offerings in the area. Most of the cafes in the neighborhood tend to be very coffee centric. The Grind carries Mighty Leaf and have all of your staple varieties (plus a little more.)

Finally, the Grind is a place you actually want to hang out at and spend a little bit of your morning and afternoon. The staff is friendly and they have a good amount of seating both indoors and out. If outdoors, you get the bonus of people/bike watching on Haight St.

excerpts: I am a daily soy/almond milk latte drinker and the final straw came when I ordered my usual large soy latte and was given a regular milk latte.
I wanted to make sure it was a soy latte since the super cool barista only said "latte.
She said no its a regular latte and that I need to specify next time what it is
I want before it is made.
Oh really??
(sarcasm)
And then she proceeded to charge me an extra 50 cents for a mistake they made, which is fine.
I just dont need barista hipster attitude especially since I am a regular.
If you love lots of morning tude and snooty high horse service, this is your place!
almond milk.author: Cai W.
almond milk.review: I wish I could love this place since it is my neighborhood cafe (and I adore my neighborhood) but they are terribly rude, on several occasions. The Baristas for some reason think they are a gift to the world and act accordingly. I am a daily soy/almond milk latte drinker and the final straw came when I ordered my usual large soy latte and was given a regular milk latte. I wanted to make sure it was a soy latte since the super cool barista only said "latte." She said no its a regular latte and that I need to specify next time what it is I want before it is made. Oh really?? (sarcasm) And then she proceeded to charge me an extra 50 cents for a mistake they made, which is fine. I just dont need barista hipster attitude especially since I am a regular. If you love lots of morning tude and snooty high horse service, this is your place!

excerpts: He managed an orange banana smoothie while I was able to choke down the Pear Salad and some coffee.
I have to say that this was a super tasty salad and largely proportioned with a generous side of fresh sourdough.
Best of all, I survived to roll on to the Polk Street Fair!
Day two saw me roll in after a terribly strung out night after the Polk Street Festival which saw me greet the day at 7:30am before calling it a night.
orange banana.author: Jill D.
orange banana.review:
This was a tough weekend.  By "tough" I mean mostly sleepless.  I did every debaucherous thing I possibly could and took bodily abuse to new levels.  It was fabulous!  At several points, however, I realized that my body needed nourishment.  As different groups of friends suggested eating here, I had the opportunity to dine two days in a row.  Day one saw me and a hot Austrian trying to force our e-xhausted bodies to consume nourishment.  He managed an orange banana smoothie while I was able to choke down the Pear Salad and some coffee.  I have to say that this was a super tasty salad and largely proportioned with a generous side of fresh sourdough.  Best of all, I survived to roll on to the Polk Street Fair!
Day two saw me roll in after a terribly strung out night after the Polk Street Festival which saw me greet the day at 7:30am before calling it a night.  I ordered the French Burger with fries and found it to be okay but nothing noteworthy.  The french fries were decent but I think it was a poor choice to order this variation of a hamburger as the addition of french bread makes for a heavier meal.  I couldn't finish the other half of my sandwich.
My friends who brought me here both days highly endorse the French Dip as being the best in the city.  I'll have to give this place another go-round and find out if that's true.

excerpts: I've also gotten the Mocha Smoothie and Pineapple Coconut Smoothie and they're both really yummy.
I think they are pretty pricey for the size of the cup.
I wish they had bigger cups because I slurp them down so quickly!!
pineapple coconut.author: Carmina D.
pineapple coconut.review:
I usually like to order Chicken Fried Steak or the Asian Chicken Salad. Both are very good and satisfying. 

Asian Chicken Salad has shredded chicken and mandarin oranges in them. Dressing is usually mixed in which I appreciate. 

Chicken Fried Steak is really filling and yummy. 

I've also gotten the Mocha Smoothie and Pineapple Coconut Smoothie and they're both really yummy. I think they are pretty pricey for the size of the cup. I wish they had bigger cups because I slurp them down so quickly!!

excerpts: The Pineapple Coconut smoothie here is amazing.
pineapple coconut.author: Maximilian R.
pineapple coconut.review:
The Pineapple Coconut smoothie here is amazing. I was super refreshed after having one, 

The Sicilian Omelette is really good too. Now how come I didn't give this review more stars...

Because I found a small 'screw' in my smoothie. I couldn't believe it, tasted great, but finding the screw inside was troublesome. 

I would recommend anybody to try a smoothie here, just beware. You've been warned.

excerpts: I've also had the jungle juice smoothie, which is a solid green but has a fruity-banana flavor - it's excellent.
jungle juice.author: Mike H.
jungle juice.review:
Let's start with the premise that you want some good food close by in the Lower Haight - lunch, brunch, or an early dinner - or just a coffee, tea, or smoothie. This is a place that does all of them well, in a neighborhood where most people want them sometimes, and sometimes many people want them at the same time. The result is: not enough space during peak times. Just remember that all the tables close together, inside and out, are necessary. You'll appreciate them more if you have to wait. In general though, people don't dawdle too much after they've finished and it's really busy. 

Just so you know: Order at the register, go up your drinks from the counter, and eventually bus your table...*but* you'll have food brought to the table thanks to the little numbered sign. 

Their breakfast burrito is big and darn good. Really enjoyed the omelette too. Good-sized portions for all plates, whether or not you're hung over. Good coffee and DIY water. OJ was fine. I've also had the jungle juice smoothie, which is a solid green but has a fruity-banana flavor - it's excellent. 

If you need wireless, be warned that it can be slow with several users at once. Just play nicely (be considerate of your usage) and everyone should get along fine.
